Her salary, however, is so low that it is impossible to afford a living based on that salary. To be able to meet the needs of her family, Anahit is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding pigs, and cultivating corn, potatoes, grass, and several fruits (cherries, plums, quinces, blood oranges, apples, pears, and walnuts). With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. In order to be able to meet the growing needs of her family, Anahit wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit. She needs a loan of 1000 USD to purchase three heifers. Anahit and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers.

loans.name: Cintya

texts.es:
Cintya vive en casa de los padres con su hijo en la zona de Chamocochico de la ciudad de La Paz, es mama soltera, se dedica a la venta de galletas producidas por una de las más prestigiosas fábricas en La Paz; esta actividad genera su unico ingreso y puede mantener a su familia.

El credito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar mas mercaderia ya que este negocio le genera buenos ingresos y quiere mantener su clientela y mas al contrario poder surtir su producto y obtener mas clientes. con el préstamo anterior pudo ampliar su mercado y ahora sus pedidos aumentaron.
 
El sueño de Cintya es poder tener una tienda para vender toda clase de productos.
texts.en:
Cintya lives with her son in her parents' house in the Chamocochico area of the city of La Paz. Cintya is a single mother and makes a living selling biscuits that are produced by one of the most prestigious factories in the city. This work provides Cintya with her only source of income and, with it, she can support her family.

This loan will be used to increase capital and to buy more merchandise. The business is providing a good income and CIntya wants to keep her customers and have new ones too. If she stocks up her business she will have more customers. With her previous loan, Cintya was able to increase her market share and her orders increased.

Cintya's dream is to have a shop in order to sell all types of products.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of biscuits and "paneton" (a kind of cake) in order to fill orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two additional computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Savage Square Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamaraneh Savage Square” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the each in the group in order to invest in their individual businesses. 

Adama is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Adama is fifty-four-year-old, she is married with five children – two are attending primary school, one is attending secondary school and one is in college. Her husband is a driver. Adama sells palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan, Adama will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of palm-oil to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm-oil to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy photographic material to help boost his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers and a variety of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorethe is 48 years old. She is married with six children.

To earn a living, she sells sorghum and bananas for sale.

With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy more bananas. She plans on saving the profits she expects to be able to generate from the business as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas for re-sale.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es:
José estudio hasta 2º grado, dado que sus padres no tenían la facilidad económica, porque eran personas de escasos recursos económicos, eso complico que continuaran con sus estudios. Sin embargo, sus padres le enseñaron a que trabajara y fuera una persona responsable. Hoy esta acompañado, su esposa se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas.

Desde la edad de 10 años José ayudaba a su padre, a realizar la siembra de maíz y sorgo, ademas de llevar a los potreros al poco ganado que su padre tenia. Toda su vida ha estado ligado a la agricultura y ganadería, esta en su sangre y es de donde todo este tiempo ha logrado darle a su familia lo necesario y que nada les haga falta. Así sus hijos han logrado estudiar y podrán en un futuro optar a un trabajo, gracias al sacrificio de José y su esposa. Actualmente, cosecha 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y tiene 4 vacas a las cuales todos los días, lleva a los potreros, para que se alimenten. Ademas su esposa, se a dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de ganado de repasto, con lo que se estará ayudando a que  José pueda invertir, para aumentar el numero de animales en el hato. Así podrá continuar con la actividad productiva que conoce y que mas le gusta, gracias al préstamo.

José tiene el sueño de tener unas 30 vacas y si le es posible mas, pero sabe que es necesario que continué esforzándose como hasta este día lo hecho, lo mas importante que tiene el apoyo de su familia. También, le gustaría sembrar este año 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz mas, para tener mayor producción y con las ganancias ir comprando de a poco, una o dos vacas por año. Para su familia desea lo mejor y sabe que la mejor herencia que puede dejarle a sus hijos es la educación que les ha facilitado en este tiempo y que ellos han sabido aprovechar, porque reconocen su esfuerzo y el de su esposa.
texts.en:
José studied through the second grade. His parents did not have financial stability because they were people of limited means which made it problematic to continue his studies. However, his parents taught him to work and to be a responsible person. Today he is accompanied by his wife who works raising pigs and chickens.

From the age of ten José helped his father growing corn and sorghum in addition to taking the small herd of cattle to the pasture his father had. His entire life has been linked to agriculture and cattle. It is in his blood and how he has managed all this time to give his family what they need so that they lack nothing. His children have been able to study and will be be able to apply for jobs thanks to the sacrifice of José and his wife. Currently he is harvesting 14,000 square meters of corn and has 4 cows that he takes to pasture every day so they can feed. In addition, his wife works raising chickens and pigs.

José will use the loan to buy cattle to pasture, helping him to invest by increasing the number of animals in the herd so he can continue the productive work he knows, and what is more enjoys, all thanks to the loan.

José has a dream of having 30 cows, and if possible more, and he knows that it is necessary to continue striving until that day comes, and the most important thing is that he has the support of his family. Also, he would like to plant 14,000 square meters of corn this year, and to have better production and with his profits to buy 1 or 2 cows per year. He wants the best for his family and knows that the best legacy he can leave his children is the education he has provided them and they have taken advantage of, because they are aware of his efforts and those of his wife.

loans.use: to buy cattle to pasture.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 23-year-old, single, young man from Tulkarm city. He lives with his family in a very humble house. Saeed started his own project one year ago. He opened a small coffee shop in the city where he sells soft drinks and light sandwiches. It is a good project and earns a good income.
 
Saeed took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a refrigerator for his coffee shop. By taking this loan, Saeed can improve his project and also increase his income.
 
Saeed appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Silvia Yadira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Silvia, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos niñas  de 9 y 3 años, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Silvia con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos pagar los gastos de estudios de sus hijas se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, toallas y edredones, ella también vende mercadería de temporada, actualmente está vendiendo artículos con motivos navideños además de ropa que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días unas dos horas por día, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 7 años  en esta actividad que le sirve para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Grupo de Credit Mujeres Unidas meets every 15 days in the Abdón Calderón neighborhood in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in every season of the year and for being a city of exceptional beauty with many tourist attractions.

Silvia lives here. She is 30 years old, married with two daughters aged 9 and 3 years old. The eldest is a student. Her husband is a businessman.

Silvia works selling clothing, sheets, towels, and comforters in order to have her own income and help pay the cost of studies for her daughters. She also sells seasonal merchandise. Currently she is selling nativity themed items besides the most requested items selling at the present time. She is a door to door vendor. She works every day for about 2 hours a day. She leaves the items on credit and collects every week or every other week according to the needs of her customers. She has been doing this work for more than 7 years and it has enabled her to get ahead.

This loan is going to used to buy all types of clothing. She has been a member of the El Grupo de Credit Mujeres Unidas since the beginning and she likes it because of the benefits and loans that the institution offers. Her dream is to have her own home as they rent the home where they live.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Sad 10 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE SAD 10 est composé de 10 personnes  qui habitent dans le même quartier et faisant tous les mêmes activités. La personne qui a levée la main sur la photo est leur présidente et il s’appelle Modou. Il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans l’agriculture et le maraichage et commence sa journée à 6h et la termine à 19h. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrants  pour pouvoir cultiver son périmètre agricole. Il gère les charges  quotidiennes de sa famille. A l’avenir il voudrait être un fournisseur en légumes pour l’ensemble des vendeurs du marché.  Ainsi il pourra  augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group (GIE) Sad 10 is made up of ten people, who all live in the same neighbourhood, and all work in the same type of business.

Modou (with his hand raised in the photo) is the group's president.  He is married and has children.  He is a farmer and grows vegetables.  His working day starts at six in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.

Modou will use his loan to buy seed and fertilizer to extend his area of cultivation.  He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family.

In the future, Modou would like to become a vegetable supplier for the market stallholders.  In this way, he would increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for vegetable growing.

loans.name: Sad 7 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE SAD 7 est composé de 10personnes qui habitent le même quartier et faisant tous la même activité. La personne qui a levé la main sur la photo s’appelle Mamadou, il est le président du groupement. Il est marié et père de famille. Il pratique l’agriculture et le maraichage et a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Il a deux femmes et cinq enfants, et c’est lui seul qui prend en charges toutes leurs charges ainsi que leur dépense quotidienne. Il demande ce montant pour acheter des intrants et semences comme le carotte, choux, piment, arachides ……. A l’avenir il souhaite et grâce aux crédits l’institution devenir le fournisseur de légumes pour les revendeurs.
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group (GIE) Sad 7 is made up of ten people who all live in the same neighbourhood, and all run the same type of business.

Mamadou (with his hand raised in the photo) is the president of the group.  He is married to two women, and has five children.  He is the only person responsible for the day-to-day financial needs of his family.  Mamadou is a farmer and grows vegetables, he has more than ten years' experience in his business.

Mamadou will use his loan to buy fertilizer and seed, such as carrots, cabbages, chillies and peanuts.

In the future, with the help of loans from the field partner, Mamadou would like to become a vegetable supplier to wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for vegetable growing.

loans.name: Marie Augustine

texts.fr:
Madame Marie Augustine originaire d’un village situé à environ 65 km de la ville principale, s’active dans l’agriculture. Une fois que la récolte a été faite, elle se charge de la seconde étape qui est de séparer la coque, de la graine d’arachide et pour le mil, de le battre et de le trier. Cela terminé, elle pourra alors aller proposer ses produits dans le marché .Marie Augustine est très brave et cela fait plus de 20 ans maintenant qu’elle s’active dans ce domaine. Elle travaille pendant 13h de temps et adore son métier. Elle est mariée et mère de famille ; elle appui son mari d’ailleurs dans la gestion de ses derniers. Elle donne aussi un coup de main à ses frères et sœurs dans la grande famille.
Marie Augustine a le souci de construire une maison pour loger ses enfants pour qu’ils n’envient pas leurs prochains.
texts.en:
Marie Augustine comes from a village about 65 kilometres from the main town.  She works in agriculture.  Once the crop has been harvested, she undertakes the second step which is to separate the shell from the peanut, or to beat the millet and separate it.  When she has done this, she can take it to market for sale.  

Marie Augustine is very courageous,  she enjoys her work and works thirteen hours a day.  She has worked in this business for more than twenty years.  Marie Augustine is married and has children, she helps her husband with the expenses of their family.  She also helps her brothers and sisters in her larger family.  

In the future, Marie Augustine would like to build a house for her family so that they do not feel deprived compared to others.

loans.use: to process peanuts and millet, for resale at the market.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Sope Serigne Fallou est le nom donné à un groupe de crédit composé de trois femmes qui habitent ensemble dans le même village. S’activant dans le petit commerce, elles ont pensé renouveler leur crédit afin de chercher de la marchandise et satisfaire leur client.
La responsable du groupe, madame Mbène qui se trouve au milieu sur la photo, a une expérience de plus de 11 ans dans son domaine d’activité qui consiste à vendre des produits alimentaires et non alimentaires en ville. De l’arachide, du mil ainsi que des balaie, de l’encens sont les produits qu’elle va se procurer pour revendre. Elle est mariée et appuie son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle participe à la scolarisation de ses enfants et met de l’argent de coté pour prévoir des imprévus.
Elle est très ambitieuse car elle désire devenir une grande grossiste dans le temps.
texts.en:
Sope Serigne Fallou credit group is made up of three women who live together in the same village.  They all work in commerce, and would like to renew their loan in order to buy merchandise to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Mbène is the head of the group, and is standing in the middle of the photo.  She has more than eleven years' experience in her business of selling food and non-food products in the town.  She will use her loan to buy peanuts, millet, brushes and incense for resale.

Mbène is married and helps her husband with the expenses of their family.  She helps pay the school charges of their children, and saves some money to help them cope with unexpected expenses.  

Mbène is very ambitious because she would like to become a large wholesaler at some stage in the future.

loans.use: to buy food products and non-food products for resale.

loans.name: Moyad

texts.en:
Moyad in a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with two sons and one daughter. All of them are attending school. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income, which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Moyad decided to start working on a richshaw in the local market where he can transfer goods for the traders. 

Moyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new richshaw to transfer goods in the market. By taking this loan, the family income will increase and also their living conditions will improve. Moyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new richshaw to transfer goods in the market

loans.name: Refqa

texts.en:
Refqa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Refqa is a 35-year-old married woman from Gaza City. She lives with her husband and kids in a simple house in the city. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Refqa has a problem in her neck and she must undergo an urgent surgery. She took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the hospital expenses for her neck surgery. By taking this loan, Refqa will be able to do her daily work without pain.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses  for her neck surgery

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of two sons and three daughters. All of the children are under 10 years old. Zeyad is an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. He also opened his own business six years ago. He rents some wedding party supplies, such as chairs and speakers. It is a good business and helps him in part with the family expenses. 

Zeyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chairs to rent for his business. By taking this loan, Zeyad will be able to develop his business and increase his income.

Zeyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chairs to rent for his business.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Tahani is a 31-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother with three sons and one daughter. All of them are attending school. Tahani's husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income that is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Two years ago, he started working in the local market where he transfers goods for the traders. He uses a rental rickshaw. It is a good business and helps him with part of the family's expenses.

Tahani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new rickshaw for her husband to work with instead of the rental one. By taking this loan, the family's income will be increased and their living conditions improved. Tahani's husband would like to improve his business in the future by buying a car.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with 4 children. Delia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.                           

Delia is a business woman and manages a "sari-sari" (variety) store to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy inventories, such as basic commodities, for her sari-sari store.                                                                                      

Delia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Delia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy inventories, such as basic commodities, for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is from Plaridel and never gets tired with her farming activities. She tills her rice land and sells her produce.

At the age of 63, Reynalda supported her 2 children out of her rice production. Now she is asking for a loan to pay for farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.). She hopes that she could retire with enough savings.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is separated with 2 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Gonosan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

Susan sells native chickens to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to pay for additional native chickens.

Susan has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Susan hopes to engage in another business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for additional native chickens

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with 6 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Elvie sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 9 years. Each month she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Elvie hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Birame

texts.fr:
Birame est un jeune célibataire qui fait de l’embouche bovine depuis plus de 5 ans. Il a un bon antécédent de crédit et avec ce renouvellement, il espère pouvoir acheter quatre à cinq bœufs pour ajouter à son troupeau. Le matin il prend tous les animaux pour les amener en brousse et les faire paitre et c’est vers 18heures qu’il replie avec eux. Il prend lui-même soin de ses bêtes car il est passionné par les animaux domestiques.
Birame vit dans la maison familiale et participe à la dépense quotidienne. Il appuie dès fois ses frères et sœurs dans leurs scolarités et leurs petits besoins. 
Birame rêve de construire une maison  et de développer son embouche et devenir l’un des plus grands éleveurs de la région.
texts.en:
Birame is a young, single man who has worked in beef farming for more than five years.  

He has a good loan history, and will use this new loan to buy four or five beef cows to add to his herd.  Each morning he takes his animals to graze in the bush, and he returns with them around six in the evening.  He takes care of his own animals as he is passionate about them.  

Birame lives in the family home and contributes to the day-to-day costs of his family.  He sometimes helps his brothers and sisters with their school expenses.  

Birame dreams of building a house one day, and expanding his business to become one of the biggest livestock farmers in the region

loans.use: to buy beef cows to fatten up for resale.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with 3 children. She is 60 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Elsie is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Elsie hopes to put up another business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Jainny

texts.en:
Jainny is a widow and a resident of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She earns a living through selling packages of tempura. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 11 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tempura stock for her business.

Jainny deeply wishes to maintain her position as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy stocks of tempura to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2005 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She has a small piece of farm land near her home.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs. Anita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is 64 years old, married and a resident of Manguiles, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She earns a living through farming vegetables.

She has been a member of PMPC since 2012 and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden business.

Bernalda deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden business.

loans.name: Chiquita

texts.en:
Chiquita is 69 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to help the family, she operates a sari-sari store. 

In 2001, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 6,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Imilda

texts.en:
Imilda joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2010 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to buy seedlings for her vegetable garden business.

Imilda dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for vegetable gardening.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old and is happily married with two kids. She has a sari-sari store business intended to provide for her family's needs. 

In 2006, Marilyn applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Marilyn has asked for financial assistance of PHP 14,900 to purchase stock for her sari-sari store. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and this will be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora has a small business making dusters. She earns a promising income of PHP 8,000 per month. This is how she supports her family and the school needs of her four children. 

Adora joined PMPC in 2004 and has paid back her previous loans in a timely fashion. Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw materials to make straw dusters. She hopes to maintain a good standing with the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make straw dusters.

loans.name: Besilda

texts.en:
Besilda is 55 years old and married with three children. Besilda works very hard to provide for them.

Besilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Besilda has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Besilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is from San Pedro, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 54 years old and is married with seven children of school-age. 

In 2008, Isidra applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Isidra has asked for financial assistance of PHP 40,000 to buy inventory for her school canteen business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and this will be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her school canteen business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 30 years old,  married and a resident of Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They have one child of school-age.  Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, Aileen opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in 2013. 

Now she is applying for 3,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic goods.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Rice is one of the most essential foods we eat. This is the reason why many entrepreneurs invest in this kind of business. In fact, Lilian is one of the people engaged in this sector. She has been involved in it for more than seven years. She is a widow and has four children. She lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

In the year 2002, she become a member of PMPC. Indeed she asks financial assistance of an amount of PHP 8,000 for the purpose of rice production.

loans.use: To buy more rice.

loans.name: Jay Neil

texts.en:
Jay Neil is 28 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child. 

Jay Neil is engaged in duck raising and the duck egg-laying business  and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 50 ducklings, three sacks of feed and vitamins for his business. Jay Neil has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jay Neil hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional ducklings, sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 68 years old, married with four children, and a resident of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She earns a living through food vending near the school and sometimes at the market.

She has been a member of PMPC for 14 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy ingredients for snack vending.

Saturnina deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Rizalita

texts.en:
Rizalita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2005 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.  She has a sari-sari (convenience) store business where she generates income to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP. This loan is intended to buy stock for sari-sari store business. Rizalita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for sari-sari store business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Cristina is a chainsaw operator and supplies coco lumber to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 5 coconut trees to be cut and be processed for coco lumber.  

Cristina has been a member of PMPC since December 2013. In the future, Cristina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing 5 coconut trees

loans.name: Verlin

texts.en:
Verlin is 39 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Verlin is engaged in a hog-fattening activity and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan which she will use to purchase three sacks of feed for her hog-fattening activity. Verlin has been a member of PMPC since July 2013. In the future, Verlin hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of feed.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be resilient. He operates a retail business where he sells groceries. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of water storage facilities. He will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank for storing clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will open another business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Luzmienda

texts.en:
Luzmienda is 60 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. 

Luzmienda is engaged in a duck raising and duck laying activity and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 300 ducklings, 10 sacks of feed and five bottles of vitamins for the ducks.  

Luzmienda has been a member of PMPC  for almost nine years. In the future, Luzmienda hopes to expand her business even more.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional ducklings, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 48 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Rhoda is engaged in a hog-fattening activity and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing three more piglets, three sacks of feed and vitamins for her hog fattening activity.  Rhoda has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Rhoda hopes to expand her business even more.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional piglets, sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail shop where she sells books and pens and offers printing and photocopying services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Irene will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of books, printing paper, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of books, printing paper, and other items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Agnes describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to add to her stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of charcoal for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a  Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a food stall where she sells fruit and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Patricia describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a  Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself to be sincere. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are the general public. 

John describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy spare parts and fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts and fuel for his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts  and  fuel for his motorcycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a  Kiva borrower. She has six children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. 

Josephine will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be God-fearing and optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She describes her family challenge to be lack of water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 6,000 loan to buy a water tank for storing clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will open another business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is married with one child. Joselito is 59 years old and lives in Carangan, Ozamiz City.

He has this business for two years now. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to restock the store with basic commodities.

Joselito has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, he wants to have another type of business to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he rears chickens for sale. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a convenient place and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to buy more stock. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more chickens for resale.

His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more chickens

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
This is Ariel, 25, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for the everyday expenses.

Ariel operates a market stall. He sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. He buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells them per kilo. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand his product inventory. 

Ariel hopes to have another stall and dreams that his family is always in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits and vegetables needed in his business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of stock. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of medicine. Her business goal is to have a larger business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family with business income. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To add a stock of medicine.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be strong. He operates a fruit stall where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more fruits for resale. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be wealthy. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more fruits for resale

loans.name: Wairimu

texts.en:
Wairimu is a 50-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as enterprising. She operates a grocery store where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an  area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that most vegetables she sells are perishable. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a stock of groceries for resale. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family with business income. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock for the business.

loans.use: To add a stock of groceries.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children aged two and four. He describes himself as determined and confident. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for five years.

His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation problems and the fact that tea production declines during the cold seasons. 

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to build a home for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Astarico

texts.en:
Astarico is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined and a go-getter. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to be very prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a steady and happy family.

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Adama. She is married and has two children, ages 23 and 11. In 1998, Adama established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed and assist her husband. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are fish sellers. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profits. In the future, Adama plans to build a house and take good care of her children's education. She was able to pay her children's schooling fees. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a poultry business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Josie is borrowing 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from seven to 21 years old. She describes herself as enterprising. She operates a retail shop where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for seven years. 

Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of stock. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics for resale. 

Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family with the business income. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock for her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 36-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 6 to 21 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals for resale. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock to her business and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are of all age groups. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be experienced. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, milk, sugar, groceries, charcoal and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

His business is located in a viable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to buy more stock. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more groceries, sugar, bread and other items he sells in his shop.

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more groceries, sugar, bread and other items to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from ten years to nineteen years. She describes herself to be innovative. 

Lucy operates a retail shop where she sells bread, wheat flour, sugar, drinks and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more stock.

Lucy will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stocks of sugar, bread, drinks, flour and other items she sells. Her business goal is to open a bigger shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock for the business.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, bread, drinks, flour and other items

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children, and he describes himself to be committed. 

Robert operates a transport business where he transports customers and goods using his tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather conditions especially during the rainy season, which affects business. 

Robert will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy spare parts and fuel for his tuk tuk. His business goal is to be successful within five years, and he hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM, and he will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel for his tuk tuk

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 32 years old and married with three children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

Anita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Anita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more bails of uniforms

loans.name: Joselin Estefania

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Joselin, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión de la cual tiene un  hijo de tres años de edad. El marido trabaja en una institución del Estado.
Doña Joselin con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos por catálogos de Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días en la mañana ya que a esa hora su mamá le cuida a su pequeño y le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 3 años  en esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva 4 años en el grupo de crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le ofrece la institución. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Mujeres Unidas gets together every other week in Abdón Calderón neighborhood, in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that have many visitors all year round, and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions. This is where Joselin lives, a 22-year old woman who lives with her partner and has a 3-year old son. Her partner works in a State institution. 

Joselin sells clothes, shoes and catalog products from Avon, Yanbal and Belcorp (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women accessories) with an aim to earn her own income and help her partner support their household expenses. She sells door to door and works every day in the morning, when her mother is taking care of the little one. She sells on credit and gets paid every week or two weeks, depending on her clients' preferences. She has worked in this business for over 3 years and things are going well. Her top selling products are cosmetics and perfumes. 

She will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and lotions. She has been with the credit group for 4 years and she appreciates the support the institution offers. She currently lives in a rented house and her dream is to have her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 33-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from eight to 16 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of permanent place to do business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent place for doing business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 30-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two to eight years. He describes himself to be determined and confident. 

Joshua operates a retail business where he sells cereals, and he has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to be successful within five years.

Joshua hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to invest in other businesses. He also grows tea and also has dairy cows, which produce milk for sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es separada,  tiene dos hijos ambos estan en etapa escolar,  vive en casa de sus padres, casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario; actualmente ella trabaja con su hermano atendiendo una heladeria, en la misma casa ella abrio un minicine (lunes a sabado), donde ofrece a su clientela (en su mayoria niños), una variedad de peliculas(estrenos), ademas de una variedad de golocinas y pipocas de maiz, los  dias domingos vende zapatos en una de las ferias  de la ciudad de El Alto, ya que ella cubre con todos los gastos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una variedad de modelos de zapatos ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y las ventas tienden a subir, ademas equipar mejor su minicine (comprará más sillas de plástico).
El sueño de Claudia es tener  mas minicines y tener una tienda donde ofresca zapatos.

Es la segunda   vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Claudia is separated. She has two children who go to school and lives in her parents’ house, located in an area called Villa Adela, in the city of El Alto. Claudia studied up to the secondary level and is now working with a brother in an ice-cream shop. She opened a “mini theater” in the same building, where she offers her clients –who are mainly kids–, a wide variety of films (recently released), candies and popcorn. Every Sunday, she sells shoes at one of the city’s fairs. She covers all her family’s expenses.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy different types of shoes now that the holidays are approaching and sales tend to increase during this season. She also wants to make some improvements to her theater, so she will buy more plastic chairs.

Her dream is to open more mini theaters and a store to sell shoes. This is the second time she requests a loan at IMPRO and her first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy different types of shoes, now that the Christmas holidays are coming.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children aged seven and ten. She describes herself as focused. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 34-year-old single man. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks, milk, bread, household goods etc. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be limited stock. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock of drinks, milk, bread an other items. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a role model in his line of business. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To add more stock of drinks, milk, bread and other items.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Abu-Bakarr. He is married and has four children, ages 17, 15, 12 and 11. In 2010, Abu-Bakarr established his Pure Water Company business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his livelihood and be self-reliant. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are the general community. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Abu-Bakarr requires a loan to buy more water plastic, water tanks and other materials for resale. In the future, Abu-Bakarr plans to become an international businessman and build a factory to help others. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more water plastic, water tanks and other materials for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 51-year-old married woman. She has ten children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She also owns another business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and cereals to resell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and cereals.

loans.name: Chepkurui

texts.en:
Chepkurui is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to eight years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transaction services. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a favorable environment and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add float to the M-pesa business (money for customers to withdraw).

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business. She also does dairy farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: To add float to her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Malachi

texts.en:
Malachi is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as influential and honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He also owns a retail shop where he sells household goods.

He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insecurity and inflation of prices. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and add stocks of bread, milk and other household goods for his retail shop. His business goal is to open a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will own a business premise. He will use the anticipated profits to invest in other areas. Previously he owned a butchery. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 250,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and add stocks of bread, milk and other household goods

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en: Cerela has run a general store for more than 22 years to earn a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used in her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy more grocery goods to resell. She always finds ways in order to augment her living, for she wants to improve her living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a busy and convenient place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 7,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables for resale. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
This is Elma, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, an employee, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Elma dreams that her business will just continue and hopes that her children will have a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Abelardo Paul

texts.es:
Abelardo tiene 31 años y vive en la ciudad de chincha, trabaja en una institución de su ciudad como inspector de calidad, con su humilde trabajo puede tener ingresos para poder llevar un sustento para su familia, sobre todo porque tiene un niño de 9 años que está en etapa escolar.

Abelardo está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder mejorar la vivienda donde habita, especialmente las paredes ya que se encuentran agrietadas por los constantes temblores, de esta manear podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”
texts.en:
Abelardo is 31 years old and lives in the city of Chincha. He works as quality inspector for an institution. With this job, he makes enough to bring food to the table. He has a nine-year-old son that goes to school.

Abelardo appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him, since he will now be able to buy construction materials to make some home improvements. In particular, he wants to fix the walls, since they have cracks due to the frequent earthquakes hitting the region. This way, he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life and make his biggest dream come true: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to fix his walls.

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya lives in the village Aghavnavanq in Tavush region. Lusya is married, and she has four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are grown up and they are all employed. Lusya’s husband is a worker. This large family’s members love and appreciate each other and all together try to help each other in any situation. This is, of course, a success of Lusya, who managed to bring up honest and kind persons. 

Lusya also works, and she has a business of her own. She owns a small hotel (four sleeping rooms) and a cute restaurant in it. Lusya is a jack-of-all-trades. She keeps no workers, and everything around her hotel she does herself; she cleans the rooms, cooks for her customers and prepares rooms for them. Now, she is thinking of changing the utensils of restaurant and the linen for sleeping rooms, in order to make it more attractive and comfortable for her customers.

She asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to purchase utensils and linen for her restaurant and hotel.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and linen for her restaurant and hotel

loans.name: Ramrose

texts.en:
Ramrose is 24 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  

Ramrose is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ramrose requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ramrose has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ramrose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 37 years old, and she lives in Yerevan. This lady is not married, and she lives with her mother and brother. Her mother is already a pensioner and her brother at this moment is unemployed. So Liana is the only bread-winner in her small family. 

Before, Liana used to work at the school as a secretary of the director of the school, but now she has changed her work and her occupation; she is engaged in a clothes trading business. She rents a stall and sells men's and women's clothes. She is only a year into this business, but she already is used to it and she likes it. She buys her stall products from the city wholesale market once a month.

Liana asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy men's and women's warm winter clothes collections for sale.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's warm winter clothes collections for sale

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is 60 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor in the Lori region. He has a daughter who is already married, and she lives with her family. So, Volodya lives with his wife in their small and cute flat. His wife works as a tailor worker, sewing fabric. Volodya works as a turner at the workshop. He has worked there for 40 years, and he is a very respected and beloved worker. 

Recently, Volodya found out that he has serious health problems, and he must urgently pass a course of treatment. He asks for a loan of 260,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some medicine and begin his course of treatment.

loans.use: to buy some medicine and begin his course of treatment

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Meet Paul, a resident of Muranga in the Central region. He is a married farmer and has eight children. He has been practicing farming for eight years, and he produces and sells milk and vegetables. He enjoys dairy farming since it brings in more income because of the high milk production.

Paul chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it helps small holder farmers to grow economically by giving them loans for assets. During the training, he learned how to develop a lifestyle of saving. This loan will help maintain an increased income, and this will help him give a better education to his children, and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga, age 43, is from the Terjola district. She is married to Grigol, who works as a security guard, in return for a small, monthly wage. 

Inga's economic activity is her newly-started grocery store, near her house, where she sells different kinds of food products. Inga works as salesperson in her store and she serves her clients in a friendly way. The business is going well, but it needs financial support for further developing. 

Now, Inga is requesting a loan to add stocks of merchandise to her store. With the received amount, she will buy products, such as rice, dairy products, snacks, and other products. She will enlarge her store and attract more customers. 

Inga plans to increase her turnover gradually and invest the profits in the same business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to add stocks of merchandise to her grocery store.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Adama.  She is married and has children aged 22 and 20 years old. In 2005, Adama established her cement business. She began her business because she needed to assist her husband in bringing up their children in terms of providing livelihood and paying for their education. Her husband gave her an amount of money to establish her own business.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Adama has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more bags of cement for her business. In the future, Adama plans to complete building her store and help in paying for her children’s education. She would like to pay for her children's schooling up through the university level and also be able to complete her store building.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement for her business

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.en: José Humberto is a Cholulteco cattle rancher and runs a butcher shop. Currently, he finds himself spending excessive amounts on non-renewable, fossil-fuel-derived propane, which he and his employees use to prepare and add value to the meat they sell. He wants to reduce his operating costs and sees his investment in a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester as an excellent opportunity. Using his biodigester, he will be able to turn the abundant cow manure generated daily on his farm into renewable energy and biofertilizer. He'll feed the system with manure and through a process of anaerobic digestion, the organic waste will be transformed into methane-rich, renewable biogas and potent organic fertilizer. José Humberto will use the biogas to replace the propane he currently uses to cook with, and the biofertilizer will be applied to his crops, improving yields without him having to spend more on petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. José Humberto will save money, help the environment, and more completely benefit from what his animals provide him. This loan represents 50% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 43 years old, married with four daughters and one son. His wife is a housekeeper. He grows vegetables (cabbages, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and etc.) and sells them at the local bazaar. He has 10 years experience in this area and his monthly income is 60 AZN.

In Azerbaijan, people's demand for fresh vegetables is very high. They use them to prepare delicious national dishes (cabbage dolma, tomato dolma and etc.). People know that fresh vegetables are very useful for health and prepare healthy fresh salads from them too.

Rustam's family is very big and his monthly income isn't enough to cover their needs. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and other sorts of vegetables. He has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and other sorts of vegetables.

loans.name: Khalowd Group

texts.en:
Khalowd is a four-member group of women from Sana`a, Yemen. They are requested a loan from AMB for 120,000 YER. 

Ibtsam is 23 years old, married, and has children. She is the leader of the group. She completed secondary school and is living in a poor area in Sana`a. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house may fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house but now she needs more money. She needs to complete the renovation, so she requested a loan of 30,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to use for construction her house

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en:
Bashira is 50 years old, married and has three sons. Her husband is a farmer. She works in a small shop as a seller and has 20 years of experience. She sells such daily products as bread, butter, sugar, salt, rice, pasta and etc. Beside that the assortment of her shop includes washing powder, tooth paste, soap and other household goods. Bashira's monthly income is 180 AZN. 

People in Azerbaijan are used to buy all the things they need in small shops. Such shops are situated almost in every yard and prices there are cheaper. Local people visit Bashira's shop very often because of their high demand for daily products and household goods. 

Bashira wants to expand her small business and to improve her family's life. She applied for 2,000 AZN loan in order to purchase more goods from suppliers. This is her fourth loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more goods from suppliers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
