Joseph is a married man. He has four children. He operates a transport business where he transport customers using a bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions especially during rainy season and this affects his business. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting customers and goods. 

He has been transporting customers using his bicycle and he wants to upgrade to a motorcycle which is faster and less tiresome. This will enable him to serve more customers and travel longer distances. His business goal is to be very prosperous within five years.

He hopes that in the future, he will own a car hire business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more bicycles for hire. This will enable him increase his income further.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 4 years and 6 years. She describes herself as consistent. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individual consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to buy stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stocks of sugar, milk, bread, soap and other items that she sells. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. She also farms to earn extra income. She will use the anticipated profts to buy a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, milk, bread, soap and other items that she sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Hassan. He is single and has one child, age 6. In 2012, Hassan established his shoes, clothes and cosmetics business. He began his business because he wants to become self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hassan requires a loan in order to buy more clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for resale. In the future, Hassan plans to become an international businessman. He is very hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad  estado civil casado vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

José se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.
Vende sus productos en Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar su vivienda. El desafío que se enfrenta  el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. He is a member of the 30 de Noviembre credit group located in the community of Mina de Piedra in the Ventanas canton. It is dedicated to agriculture and livestock work.

José works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He is asking for the loan to buy materials and do some specific maintenance on his crops. He sells his products in Ventanas. His dream is to improve his home. The challenge he faces is bad weather. In his free time, he likes to be with his family and play sports.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 53 years old. She is married and has nine children aged between 13 and 34. 

With the loan, she wants to buy sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is 38 years old and she lives in Gandzaqar in Tavush region. She is a mother of three children (two sons and a daughter). Anzhela’s husband works as a forester and he also provides cargo services with his own truck. He helps Anzhela very much, since she is engaged in farming and agriculture.

In her farm she has five cows, 30 chickens and a large piece of land on which she cultivates vegetables and fruits. She manages to sell dairy products, eggs, figs, persimmons and apples. 

Anzhela also wants to begin swine breeding and she decided to ask a loan in order to start this activity. She needs a loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy piglets and some animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy piglets and some animal fodder for the winter period.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 33 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida en la vivienda donde habita, de esta manera mercedes puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo sacar adelante a su hijo de 8 años al cual quiere mucho.

Mercedes esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en el piso de su negocio ya que actualmente des de tierra, de esta manera podrá brindar un ambiente más limpio y tendrá más clientes; así ella podrá seguir mejorando y luchando para hacer realidad su sueño de darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 33-years-old. With great effort, she got a start to her business selling food from her home so that she can have income to cover the costs of her household and especially to raise her 8-year-old son whom she loves very much. 
Mercedes is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks them for the great support so that she can buy construction materials to make improvements in the floor of her business. Currently, it is a dirt floor. By improving the floor, she can create a cleaner  environment and have more clients. In this way, she can continue improving and struggling to make her dream a reality: to give her child a profession.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to improve her shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and she has two children. She describes herself to be experienced. 

Grace operates a retail business where she sells animal feed. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are livestock owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital to buy more stock. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of animal feed to sell. 

Grace’s business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of animal feed to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children aged three and seven. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, rice, cooking oil, milk, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of products which affect sales. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice, milk, bread and other items she sells. Her business goal is to own a wholesale within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will own many businesses and help young people. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. She also supplies agricultural products to schools to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice, milk, bread and other items.

loans.name: Farman

texts.en:
Farman is a 40-year-old pensioner. He is married and has three daughters. His wife is a housekeeper. The main source of the family's income is an auto service company, and Farman has 20 years of experience in machinery. His monthly income is 110 AZN.

The demand in auto service is high enough. People use it when they need to repair their car or wash it.  Such private auto services are used often. People prefer them because they are cheaper.

Farman wants to repair the auto service place and expand his business. He is planning to increase his monthly income and provide his daughters with higher education and a bright future. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy additional new equipment for his service. This is his fourth loan, and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy additional new equipment for his service

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old married woman and she has three children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Jane operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy and convenient location and her primary customers are of all age groups. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food. 

Jane’s business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua-San Salvador Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Salvador, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes ella es soltera y tiene 52 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 2 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de carne, negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de confección de ropas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR" communal bank in the San Salvador district of Calca province in the department of Cusco. 

The featured borrower is Lourdes, who is a 52-year-old widow.  She works in her grocery shop, from 8am until 9pm, selling essentials such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She has been running her business for 2 years and is successful in it.  Her ambition is to extend her grocery shop.  She is applying for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

 
The businesses run by the other group members involve selling meat, livestock and groceries and dressmaking.  


Lourdes is grateful to those who are helping her to achieve her ambition in this way and she guarantees that she will make her repayments within the set time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be experienced in business. He operates a clothes store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a viable place with plenty of customers, and his primary customers are men. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stocks of clothes. He will use the Kes 120,000 loan to add to his stock of clothes for resale. This will enable him to have enough stock to sell and meet his customers' demands. He specializes in selling men's suits.

His business goal is to be a successful business man within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed in his business. This is his seventh loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add to his stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora de 37 años de edad, desgraciadamente sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de que estudiara, ya que ellos consideraban que era una perdida de tiempo el que ella asistiera a la escuela. Hoy esta acompañada, su esposo al igual que ella, es agricultor y juntos trabajan la tierra, tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 asisten a la escuela.

Desde la edad de 10 años, María trabaja en la agricultura, ya que su padre sembraba 21 metros cuadrados de maíz  y ella junto a sus hermanos ayudaban en las labores agrícolas. Así aprendió el oficio, hoy tiene 17 años de estar acompañada y su esposo es agricultor, juntos realizan la producción de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 14,000 de sorgo y sus hijos le ayudan, cuando no les toca asistir a la escuela. Razón que a permitido que el hogar este fortalecido, gracias a que entre el grupo familiar, hay confianza y respeto. Sus labores inician a las 4.30 am todos los días, para prepararse a una nueva jornada de trabajo, que termina a eso de las 12.00 pm; para luego por la tarde realizar las quehaceres del hogar.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar ganado, para criarlo y venderlo dentro de un año. Así, no depender solo de la agricultura, dado que en los últimos años han ocurrido perdidas en el cultivo y hay repercusiones, puesto que los ingresos no son suficientes para los gastos del hogar de todo el año. Con el préstamo, se esta ayudando a que María y su familia experimenten, otra forma diferente de producir.

María tiene la ilusión de continuar trabajando y esforzándose mucho, junto a su esposo, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A la vez darle la oportunidad que ella no tubo a sus hijos de que puedan estudiar y así prepararse academicamente y no se enfrenten a las dificultades que ella ha tenido que pasar. Ademas, de esto le gustaría crecer en el negocio de crianza de ganado y espera que todo le salga muy bien, para invertir mas el próximo año y de las ganancias  mejorar la infraestructura de la casa.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking 37 year old woman. Unfortunately, her parents didn't give her an opportunity to have an education, since they considered it a waste of time for her to go to school. Today she is married and her husband is also a farmer. Together they work the land and have four children. Three of them are in school.

Since she was 10 years old, María has worked in farming. Her father planted 21 square meters of corn and she and her siblings helped with the farm work. This is how she learned the trade. Today she has been married for 17 years and her husband is a farmer. Together they grow 14,000 square meters of corn and another 14,000 of sorghum. Their children help them when they are not in school. This has allowed for the household to be fortified, since in the family group there is respect and trust. Her work begins at 4.30 a.m. every day, getting ready for a new work day. It ends at 12.00 p.m. In the afternoon, she does the housework.

The loan will be used to buy cattle to raise and sell within a year. This way, she doesn't just depend on farming. In the last few years there have been crop losses and repercussions because there wasn't enough income for the yearly household expenses. With the loan, Maria and her family are being helped with trying another way of producing.

María dreams of continuing to work hard to and strive with her husband to improve the family's quality of life. She also wants to give her children the opportunity she didn't have to go to school and prepare themselves academically so they won't face the difficulties she has had to go through. In addition, she would like to grown the cattle raising business and she hopes that it goes well for her so she can invest next year and from the earnings improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell within a year.

loans.name: Annta Gopal Shg Group

texts.en:
Annta Gopal Shg is a self-help group consisting eleven members from a small village of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are women and all are engaged in activities like grocery shop, milk selling, tea stall, etc.They have made this group having a dream to be united to learn new concepts of business and help and support each other. All the members of this group are dedicated to make money to make their future secure.

One of them is Mamata, who was selected as their president. In the picture, she is the lady standing with raised hand. Mamata is 35 years old, married, and lives with her parents-in-law, her husband and three children who are in school. Her husband is a daily laborer. 

Five years ago, she started a small business of selling fruits and vegetables in the near market. She earns 3,000 INR to 4,000 INR per month from this business, which is used for her household expenses. Mamata purchases the fruits and vegetables from wholesalers and sells to the market. Now she is planning to purchase vegetables directly from the farmers so she can save some extra money.

She and her group members have requested a loan amount of 165,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy fresh fruits, vegetables and big baskets directly from the farmer. She hopes to register her children in a good school in near future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fruits, vegetables and big baskets directly from the farmer.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (D) Group

texts.en:
The Maa Santoshi Shg self-help group is about to enter their first cycle in People's Forum. The group is made up of 11 members and is led by the president, Janaki. In picture the lady standing with raised hand is Janaki. The members are involved in a variety of businesses that include blanket weaving, food sales, corner stores, purchase and sale of cattle. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small businesses that Janaki is a member and president of. She states that this is the first time they have joined People's Forum. They were invited by a sponsor from the institution who visited her home. Currently, Janaki has a business catching and selling fish. She learned this trade many years ago because it was a family business, and after meeting her husband, she decided to branch out on her own. 

The loan will help her to purchase nets that she will buy from the wholesalers in the city of Bhubaneswar, and she will then install them in her work space. This line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family as she lives with her husband, parents-in-law and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about People's Forum, she said she likes the training offered by the institute. She wants to say, "Thank you" to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase nets to catch the fish.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a quarry where he sells building stones.He has been involved in this business for 22 years He now wants to start dairy farming to enable him to earn more income, and he has taken a loan of KES 80,000 to buy a dairy cow that will produce milk to sell. 

His business is located in a busy area with lots of stones, and his primary customers are those interested in house construction. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects his business. It is difficult to work in the quarry during the rainy season. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. He also grows crops to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 46. She is re-married and has seven children. 

She has sold both soft drinks and beers for the past eight years. 

With the profits from the business she will buy a plot of land. 

She is very thankful for the previous loan that helped her to restock her bar. Now she has gained more profits, which turned her to a better point in her life.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest and hardworking. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

His business is located in a convenient place with lots of customers who buy his products and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition from other sellers. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and other items he sells in his shop.

He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. He also grows crops to earn extra income. He will use the anticipated profits to support his family. His previous loan of KES 60,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en:
Gunduz is 47 years old, married, and has two sons. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Gunduz has been a seller in a small market for 20 years. He sells daily products (sweets, cookies, waffles, flour, bread, cheese, lemonade) and household goods (soap, shampoo,washing powders etc.). His monthly income is 90 AZN. 

Gunduz's shop is situated at a local bazaar and people buy goods from his shop every day. They use daily products in cooking daily foods and preparing for parties and holidays. Daily products and household goods are highly needed goods.

Gunduz wants to expand his business and increase his market's monthly income. That's why he applied for 1,000 AZN loan to buy more goods for his market. He has applied for loans four times and has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his market.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself as sincere. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells pumpkins and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries to resell. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries.

loans.name: Seymour

texts.en:
Seymour is a 37-year-old married man with two sons. His wife is a housekeeper.

 He grows and sells fruits (apples, oranges, pears, lemons, bananas and etc.) and vegetables (greens, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and so on) at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 90 AZN. Seymour's brother helps him to grow fruits and vegetables.

Azeri people like eating delicious fruits and vegetables. Beside that, vegetables are used in preparing different soups (tomato soup, lentil soup), salads, national dishes such as roasted eggplant etc. Demand for fruit is also high. They use fruits to make fresh juice, fruit pies, and different sorts of jam.

Seymour wants to expand his business and improve his family's life condition. Therefore he applied for a 1,500 AZN loan. He will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Maa Dhabalei Shg Group

texts.en:
Benga, who is in her early 30s, is married and has three children; two of them are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a small village of Odisha, India. 

For 10 years now, Benga has been running a food stall business. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. With her profit, she built a house and covers part of home and children's school expenses. 

This is Benga's first loan request from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use this loan to pay for groceries like maize, baking flour, rice, beans, bananas and meat. She hopes to build a house that has a room for her business. 

Benga will share this loan with her loan group, Maa Dhabalei Shg, which has nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. All the members are very responsible and dedicated to their businesses. They are engaged in separate business activities like milk selling, fish selling, flowers selling, etc. All the group members are very excited and happy to take this opportunity to say "Thank you" to Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like maize, baking flour, rice, beans, bananas and meat for her food stall business.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 28 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more soaps and plates to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soaps and plates to sell

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 44-year-old man. He lives in Terjola with his wife, Irma, and two daughters. 

Mamuka has his own agricultural activity and his wife also helps him to prepare the work profitably. One of his daughters is a student and the other is going to school. Mamuka’s monthly income is 237 Gel and Irma’s is 35 Gel. The family has four cows and they are selling cheese. Mamuka also cultivates the vineyard, making wine and selling it to the local market. 

But they don’t have enough income to cover all the family's expenses. Mamuka decided to start a car business along with his agricultural activities. He wants to go to Germany and bring a car for sale. Mamuka thinks that business will be profitable, as there is a high demand on the market. This Start Up loan will give him a chance to increase his family income.

loans.use: to begin to trade cars.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un artesano de 48 años de edad, casado y padre de 5 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo. Desde hace 13 años se dedica a elaborar artesanías y pintura primitivista, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9:00 am a 6:00 pm, ve en esta labor la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo y es autónomo, pero el desafío principal se presenta porque las ventas de sus productos son muy variables y su economía depende de esta actividad, sin embargo ha logrado generar los recursos para dar el sustento a su familia. 
El apoyo del crédito lo solicita para invertir el dinero en la compra de materia prima (productos en cerámica y pintura), así podrá abastecerse para aumentar la producción y así cumplir con la demanda actual de sus productos, lo que le permitirá mejorar los ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Luis manifiesta que su meta principal es seguir progresando en su negocio y lograr un posicionamiento en el mercado que a mediano plazo pueda cumplir el sueño de exportar sus productos y garantizar a su familia una estabilidad económica para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is a craftsman. He is 48 years old, married and with 5 children, who he had brought up with a lot of effort and hard work. For the past 13 years, he has been working with crafts and primitive paintings. His family supports him and he works from Monday to Saturday from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. Being a freelancer, he is able to manage his own time but his biggest challenge is that his sales are very unstable and his economy relies solely on this activity. Despite these challenges, he has been able to support his family. He is asking for this loan in order to purchase raw material (ceramics and painting products). Thanks to this loan, he will be able to stock up and increase his production. By doing that, he will be able to meet his current demand for products, which will allow him to improve the income that he receives for his work. Luis says that his main objective is to continue to grow his business and to achieve a better market position, which will allow him to make his dream of exporting his products come true and to ensure an economic stability and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material (ceramics and painting products)

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is a 34-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He sells used clothes and bedsheets as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like taxis, where he earns extra income.

Nicholus faces a challenge of competition but has hopes of fulfilling his family dream and having a wholesale boutique for clothes.

He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and bedsheets for the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and bedsheets for the business.

loans.name: Amigos De Planes Group

texts.es:
María Santos, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Intibucá.
Ella siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura tiene muchos años de realizar sus propios cultivos junto a su esposo, ya que el lugar donde viven es zona agrícola y apta para estos cultivos. Cultiva papa, maíz, frijoles y repollo. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener bien sus cultivos, actualmente solicita otro ciclo el cual es por 8,500 Lempiras para comprar la semilla de papa, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas para darle asistencia a sus cultivos y  para sacar mejores cosechas. Su meta es incrementar los ingresos para su familia.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Amigos de planes, que está formado por 6 integrantes. En la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda en la fila de atrás esta María Santiago, Maria santos y Justino que es integrante nuevo del grupo; en la fila de enfrente a la izquierda esta don Juan, seguido por Justino y Nicomedes a la derecha, Todos se dedican a la agricultura de papa en la zona y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal suma Lps.41,000.que los utilizaran para comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas y otros para asistencia a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María Santos, 40 years old, is married, has 2 children and lives with them and her husband in a village that belongs to the municipality of Intibucá. She has always worked in agriculture. She has been doing her own crops along with her husband for many years, since the area where they live is agricultural and apt for these crops. She grows potatoes, corn, beans and cabbage. She sells this produce in the local market. She has applied for various loans to keep her crops well maintained.

On this occasion, she is applying for another loan for 8,500 Lempiras to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide for good assistance for her crops and to have better harvests. Her goal is to increase the income for her family.

She belongs to the Amigos de Planes lending group, which is made up of 6 members. In the photo they are identified as follows: to the left in the back row: María Santiago, María Santos, and Justino, who is a new member of the group. In the front line to the left is Juan, followed by Justino and Nicomedes to the right. They all make their living in potato farming in the area and live in the same community.

The group loan adds up to 41,000 Lempiras, which they will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and others for good assistance for their crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and others for good assistance for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: Timotea agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella pudo comprar mercadería y incremento el capital del negocio, ella continua vendiendo ropa por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas, chompas, pantalones, buzos y otras cosas para esta campaña navideña, ella participando en el banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella nació en el distrito de Challabamba de la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en el distrito antes mencionada, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Timotea thanks the investors for the loan. Because of the support offered, she was able to buy merchandise and she increased the capital of the business. She continues selling clothes. Therefore in this opportunity, she needs the loan to buy merchandise like, for example, winter coats, sweaters, pants, sportswear and other things for this Christmas season.

She is a member of the "San Martincito" village bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Paucartambo. She was born in Challabamba district, Paucartambo province and lives with her family in the aforementioned district. She is 40 years old and is married; by the fruit of this beautiful relationship she has three children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as jackets, sweaters, pants, tracksuits and others.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be sincere. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a high population area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more stocks. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stocks of rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, and other items she sells in her shop. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, and other items

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells pumpkins and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a high population area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal and pumpkins for resale. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and pumpkins for resale.

loans.name: Jay Sriram Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali, the lady standing in the middle with raised hand in the photo, is a very active woman of 38 years of age. She resides in a small house with her husband, one son of 16 years and one daughter of 12 years in a rural village named Chindaguda in the Nuapada district in Odisha, India.

For the last ten years, Gitanjali has run a general grocery shop in her small house with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, etc. She started the business with a small investment of her own. At that time, her monthly net income was around 2,000 INR. It was very difficult on her part to maintain the family. So she, with four other women of her village, formed a Joint Liability group named Jay Sriram to avail loans from Mahashakti Foundation. 

To date she has already availed three loans of 10,000, 14000 and 28,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation and has been able to expand her business. Now she is earning a monthly income of 5,000 INR. As per the statement of Gitanjali, this small income is not at all sufficient to manage the family along with educational expenses of her children, so she wants to increase her income by expansion of her existing business. 

She has planned to use the loan amount to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock frequently. She hopes that this investment will give her more income and  enough savings that she will be able to construct a house for her family, which is a dream for her, and give better education to the children. 

The other four members of the group are Sushama, Himadri, Jasobanti and Labanidei, who are running milk selling, computer center, and vegetable vending businesses.

loans.use: To pay for rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
Maria alejandra es una estudiante de auxiliar judicial esta cursando tercer semestre, esta carrera técnica le ha servido para ampliar los conocimientos acerca de lo que ella le gustaría ejercer mas adelante que es investigación judicial para poder tener mas oportunidad de colaborar con la familia ya que en este momento no cuenta con los requisitos económicos para terminar la carrera, debido a que el trabajo le suministra un salario con el cual puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y la cuota que estaba pagando anteriormente.
La carrera de investigación judicial la desea terminar para tener una base solida para poder seguir con la carrera profesional y a si poder entrar a una entidad del estado como la policía nacional, C.T.I  o la fiscalia, esta carrera le ha llamado la atención ya que desde muy pequeña le ha gustado todo lo que tiene que ver con el campo de acción, de la investigación criminal, como la criminalistica, medicina forense, derecho penal en fin, agradecería la ayuda que kiva le puede dar para que pueda terminar y tener unos conocimientos mas profundos y claros acerca de lo que le apasiona.
texts.en: Maria Alejandra is a student in the third term of her court assistant course.  This technical course has enabled her to expand her knowledge about the career she would like to pursue: forensic science.  This would allow her to help her family financially as they currently do not have the financial means to enable her to finish her course.  A career in this area would provide her with a salary which she would use to cover household costs and the fees which she was paying previously.  She wants to complete her forensic science course so she will have a solid base to continue on to a professional career and hopefully get a job in a state department such as the Police force, the Technical Investigation Corps or the Prosecution Service.  She has been interested in this type of career since she was a child and she has always liked anything connected with the field of criminal investigation, such as criminology, forensic medicine, criminal law.  She would be very grateful for any help from Kiva which would enable her to finish her course and gain a deeper and clearer understanding of the subject about which she is so passionate.

loans.use: to pay for a term's tuition and her registration fee.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 45 años de edad, desgraciadamente no asistió a la escuela, sus padres tenían una pobreza tan grande, que no les permitía, enviar a estudiar a su hijo. Sin embargo, inculcaron en él, el trabajo y que se convirtiera en una persona responsable y trabajadora. Esta acompañado, su esposa es ama de casa y tienen dos hijos.

Antonio a trabajado desde que tiene uso de razón, junto a su padre como jornalero, en las haciendas que requerían mano de obra, para diferentes actividades. Ademas, de sembrar 6 tareas de maíz, para el consumo de la familia. Toda la vida ha trabajo en la agricultura y gracias al apoyo de su esposa, han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, dándole la oportunidad de que estudien y se preparen academicamente. Ahora Antonio, produce 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de sorgo y el trabajo lo realiza junto a sus dos hijos, cuando ellos no asisten a  la escuela. El terreno esta casi un kilómetro de su casa y el recorrido lo hacen en caballo y trabajan de 6 am hasta la 1 pm. Ademas, cuando trabaja como jornalero, cuando hay trabajo en las zonas de cañales y algodoneras.

El préstamo sera invertido en la compra de dos novillas, con las cuales, Antonio espera dentro de dos años, que estas se reproduzcan y puedan aumentar el hato. Para luego tener el negocio de criá y engorde de ganado. Para así, tener dos fuentes de ingreso y no depender en su totalidad de la agricultura.

El sueño de Antonio es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para que no les falte nada, por ello es necesario tener siempre salud, para realizar las labores diarias, para llevar a casa el sustento diario, el cual no debe faltar nunca. Antonio, tiene la ilusión de crecer en el negocio del ganado, para así no depender solo de la siembra de maíz y sorgo, ya que muchas veces existen perdidas en los cultivos y es mas alto el riesgo de que en su hogar la alimentación pueda faltar. Para sus hijos desea lo mejor y que sean personas honestas y responsables tal como él les ha enseñado.
texts.en:
Antonio is forty-five years old.  Unfortunately, he did not attend school because his parents were very poor and they could not send him to school.  However, they instilled in him the desire to work, and he became a responsible and hardworking man.  He is in a common-law marriage, and his wife is a homemaker.  Together, they have two children.

Antonio has worked ever since he has had a reason to.  He works with his father as a laborer on the lands and plantations, and also tends to six corn crops for his family's consumption.  For his entire life, he has been working in agriculture.  Thanks to the support of his wife, he has been able to move his children ahead, giving them the opportunity to study and to prepare themselves academically for the future.  

Antonio now produces 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of sorghum.  He does this work together with his two children when they are not in school.  The land is almost a kilometer from their home, so they travel by horse and work from 6am until 1pm.  Antonio continues to work as a laborer when there is work on the sugar-cane and cotton plantations.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of two heifers; Antonio hopes that they will reproduce within two years and his herd will grow.  He hopes to eventually have a business raising and fattening livestock.  In this way, he will have two sources of income and he will not have to depend solely on agriculture.

Antonio's dream is to improve his family's quality of life so that they never need anything.  He always needs to be healthy so that he can perform all his daily work, which brings the food to the table every day.  Antonio has a vision of growing his livestock business so that he doesn't have to only depend on the corn and sorghum crops; there are many times when there are losses in farming, and there is a high risk that his family's food intake will suffer.  

He wishes the best for his children, and hopes they grow as honest and responsible people, just as he has taught them.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 35 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos no tuvo mas que estudiar hasta sexto grado, pues él era el mayor de los cuatro hermanos y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar, ya que sus familia era muy pobre. Está acompañado y su esposa tiene a cargo una tienda en su casa, tienen 3 hijos, 2 viven en casa y uno ya está acompañado.


Él actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz y maicillo y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo pues en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, además de trabajar en la agricultura, él se dedica a comprar y vender cerdos y también tiene una tiendita en su casa, se levanta desde las 4:00 AM y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 6 kilómetros en bicicleta, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa y le ayuda su hijo en el tiempo en el cual no está estudiando.   


utilizará el dinero del préstamo para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, pues vive en un sector donde se siembra a base de riego, él ya cuenta con un efectivo para este trabajo, pero con el dinero del préstamo podrá cubrir todas las necesidades que conlleva sus actividades económicas.

En el futuro, él tiene la visión de tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que él no tuvo, pues hoy en día quien esté mejor preparado académicamente puede conseguir un buen trabajo, él está seguro que el crédito es un compromiso pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños, será un mayor esfuerzo pero así obtendrá una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Francisco is 35 years old and, because of a lack of money, he could not study past sixth grade at school. He was the oldest of four siblings and had to help his parents with their work as the family was very poor. Francisco is married - his wife runs a shop in their house - and the couple has three children. Two of the children still live at home while the other has a partner.

Francisco currently makes a living sowing corn and sorghum, work that he has done since he was a child. Francisco's father taught him this work as, back then, the family had no way to survive except through agriculture. Apart from this work, Francisco also makes a living buying and selling pigs, and, in addition, he has a small shop in his house. Francisco gets up at 4am in order to get out to the countryside, out to his cornfields. He travels 6km by bicycle to get to work. Francisco does not have a time when he clocks out - he just works until he has done everything he needs to and then returns home.  Francisco's son helps out when he is not studying.

Francsisco will use this loan to sow corn on 14,000 square metres of land. He works in an area where crops are grown using irrigation systems. Francisco already has the money to sow the crops but, with this loan, he will be able to buy all the other necessary supplies to do his work.

In the future, Francisco would like to have a better house and to be able to give his children the education that he could not have. Francisco says that if you have a better education you can get a better job. Francisco knows that this loan is big commitment but he also knows it is the only way he can achieve his dreams. This loan will require a big effort but, with it, he can improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to sow corn on 14,000 square metres of land.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is 44, married, and has children. He is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He, together with his wife, manage their household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Teodoro operates an appliances repair shop. He offers repair and check-up of all types of appliances including televisions, electric fans, DVD players, and others. His shop is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, Teodoro is requesting a loan for8, 000 PHP, which he will use to buy spare parts and other materials needed in his electronics repair shop. Teodoro hopes to be more profitable and to have an abundant life. He meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials needed in his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Paulino Alfonso

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca la cual se caracteriza por su clima muy cálido y por poseer lugares turísticos muy hermosos Paulino vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 4 maravillosos hijos y por los cuales son ha luchado cada día para  brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y sean personas de bien.

Cada día y a tempranas horas Paulino trabaja como agricultor , el ha sembrado actualmente maíz morado, el cual es usado para la elaboración de la riquísima Chicha Morada y la mazamorra, Paulino trabaja en su parcela alrededor de 8 horas al día ya que es muy cuidadoso con su cultivo y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que hace.

Paulino está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, arar la tierra y poder mejorar su cultivo, lo que le permitirá tener una buena cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder viajar a Brazil para poder ver a su menor hija, la cual no ve hace varios años”.
texts.en:
Paulino, 58, lives in the city of Nazca, which is characterized by its very hot climate and for having very beautiful tourist places. Paulino lives alongside his wife, with whom he has 4 marvelous children and for whom they have fought for every day to provide them a better quality of life and so that they will be good people.

Every day and at early hours, Paulino works as a farmer. He has currently sewn purple corn, which is used for making the delicious Chicha Morada a [traditional corn-based beverage] and mazamorra [porridge]. Paulino works on his land about 8 hours a day, as he is very careful with his crops and, above all, because he likes what he does.

Paulino is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since this is the second time you give him your support. In this opportunity, he will be able to buy manure, fertilizers, aerate the land and improve his crops. This will let him have a good harvest and improve his income. In this manner, he will be able to continue fighting to be able to make his greatest dream come true: "To travel to Brazil to be able to see his youngest daughter, whom he has not seen in many years."

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Ijevan in Tavush region. She is 34 years old. Anna is married and she has a daughter and a son. 

For several years Anna used to work at the college as a teacher of French language, but when she got married she left her work and began taking care of her children. Today, since her children are already school-aged, she has started her own business. 

She works in a rented shop, where she sells stationery and a great range of toys for both boys and girls. Anna’s husband also works and they both manage to provide for their family. Anna says that she has many customers who constantly visit her shop since she has a great assortment and cheap prices of products. Anna hopes that with the coming of Christmas and New Year holidays, she may sell a lot of toys, which parents present their children.

Anna asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to refresh her shop’s assortment of stationery and toys for sale.

loans.use: to buy new stationery and toys for sale.

loans.name: Khadiga

texts.en:
Khadiga is a 23-year-old woman who lives with her family in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen. She is an employee with a monthly salary that she uses to support her family. She tries her best to cover what her family needs. 

Khadiga's family is currently in need of a new refrigerator, so she is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase one to use in her house. 

She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming rice. 

Emelda is requesting her third loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts for her tricycle. She hopes that her hard work will help her save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 35 years old and married. She has six children. Four of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Rose Marie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.  

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Rose Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: M. Rizwan

texts.en:
M. Rizwan is a 24-year-old married man, living with his family in Lahore, Pakistan.

He owns a bakery in his hometown. He sells all kinds of cakes, rusks, milk, biscuits, and juices. Earlier, his father was running this bakery, but due to his old age, now M. Rizwan looks after all the matters. He purchases the inventories in large quantity from wholesalers and sells them over his bakery. 

Now he wants to offer additional different types of sweets to his customers, but he does not have sufficient funds to buy these additional sweets. Therefore, M. Rizwan requested a loan so that he could buy bakery items and his desired sweets to sell. He wants to prepare these sweets at home so that he could get maximum income. 

He will make some savings with the profit amount and hopes in future he will prepare all the sweets by himself. M. Rizwan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bakery items and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas pone su mayor esfuerzo por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
La señora Gladis es la presidenta del comité y comenta que siempre trata de poder inspirar a sus compañeras a seguir trabajando y luchando. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que luego con mucho sacrificio sale a vender de forma ambulante. Su sueño es algún día poder tener un negocio estable y no tener que salir a vender de forma ambulante.
La Señora Gladis pide el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como mandioca, pan, carne, harina, para surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
The seventeen members of this group all do different kinds of work.  Each member is putting in the greatest possible effort in order to get ahead and to help their families through their work.

Gladis is the president of this group and she tells us that she always tries to encourage her members to continue working and fighting.  Gladis herself makes a living preparing meals, which she then goes out to sell as a street vendor.  Gladis' dream is, one day, to have a stable business and not to have to sell as a street vendor.

Gladis is applying for this loan in order to invest in basic supplies such as flour, cassava flour, bread and meat to stock up her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cassava flour, bread, meat and more.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
San Expedito está en el 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 15  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero deben seguir trabajando por mejorar sus vidas.
Delia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de quesos variados, comenta que tiene ya una clientela formada, pues sus productos son muy aceptados por sus clientes, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer lo que vende y así poder crecer más y más.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de quesos, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y mejorando sus ingresos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas reciben.
texts.en:
The "San Expedito" group is in their 2nd loan cycle of the Woman's Committee program. where everyone works together and helps each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey. Fifteen of them are below the poverty line, that is to say low income. They must continue to work to improve their lives. 

Delia is one of the members. She sells various cheeses. She comments that she has a clientele formed, as her products are acceptable for her customers and so things are going well. Her dream is to own a store where she could offer what she sells and be able to grow and grow. She is requesting this loan to buy cheese, which will help her with her sales and increase her revenue. She is grateful for this opportunity she and her companions are receiving.

loans.use: to buy cheese to re-sell.

loans.name: Bendición Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendición son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo, son 22 integrantes  muy responsables, todas son mamas muy trabajadoras que se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier inconveniente del grupo y se ayudan siempre  entre ellas también y así puedan salir adelante juntas.
La  señora Ceferina por ejemplo es una de las integrantes de este grupo, y pide este crédito para usarlo en  la compra de ropas ya que ella se dedica a la venta de variadas prendas, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Todas las integrantes están muy entusiasmadas por la ayuda que está recibiendo dentro del programa de comité.
texts.en: The Bendicion committee is made up of 22 members, all of whom are from the San Lorenzo zone.  They are very responsible, and are all hard-working mothers who always get together to resolve any problems that the group may have, and to help each other so that they will all be able to move forward together.  Ceferina is a member of the group who is requesting a loan to buy clothing, as she works selling various articles of clothing in order to help her family.  All of the members are very enthusiastic about the help that they are receiving from the committee's program.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Marcos está en su ciclo 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas están inspiradas por una mejor calidad de vida, y por poder ayudar a sus familias a tener todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy, ella es una señora muy activa que cuenta con una despensa en su propia casa, por medio del prestamos de los anteriores ciclos y las capacitaciones ella  es tá creciendo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana poder tener una despensa mas grande.
La Sra. Nancy  solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser carne, bebidas, leche, pan y demás para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Marcos Group is in its seventh cycle of the women’s committee program, in which each member is inspired by a better quality of life, and by providing their families with everything that they were not able to have. Nancy is one of the members of this group. She is very energetic and has a small grocery store, which is growing thanks to previous loan cycles and training sessions. Her goal is to continue growing her business and have a larger store in the future.

Nancy is requesting this loan to buy a variety of stock for her store, such as meat, drinks, milk and bread. This will help her develop a more specific business plan, which will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock for her store, such as meat, drinks, milk and bread.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: La Sra. Edith   de 42  años de edad conviviente   y madre de  2  hijos, la Sra. Edith tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de menú (comida) en un pequeño mercado (alquilado) ya hace unos  3  años. La Sra. Edith,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus platos típicos y  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos como (arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceites, cubiertos, platos etc.) Para su posterior venta  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Edith   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Edith  se encuentra sentada se le distingue por su bivirí de color azul, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Edith is 42-years-old and is a live-in partner and mother of 2 children. Edith has a small business selling prepared food dishes in a small market (rented property) for the last 3 years. 

Edith has built loyalty with her customers which have allowed her to generate earnings so that she can cover her housing expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own place where she can sell typical dishes and increase her economic earnings. With the given loan, she will invest in purchasing more products like rice, sugar, vegetable soup, oils, silver wear, plates, etc. for later sale and as a result, continue satisfying the needs of her customers and to be able to get ahead.

At the same time, Edith and all the members are very thankful for Kiva for the loan that has been provided to them and for the trust that has been established. Edith is the one sitting down and is wearing a tank top with the color blue. She wishes a farewell greeting and promises to fulfill all her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Mamaricissebougou commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de fruits, légumes, condiments des céréales, des ustensiles, etc.                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. La cliente Sira  la deuxième  personne est vendeuse de beignets de farine de blé. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de farine de blé  et  10 kg de sucre. La vente  des beignets s’effectue sur place et dans les villages voisins a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qui sera réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Mamaricissebougou, Konobougou commune, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women of the group know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell fruits, vegetables, condiments, cereals, utensils, etc. for a living. They are on their third group loan.

Sira sells beignets made of flour. She plans to buy a sac of wheat flour and ten kilograms of sugar. She sells her beignets in town and in surrounding villages to a mixed clientele. 

Sira hopes to earn a monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make beignets

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Esther es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de guantes, compra y venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada), tejido de gorros, compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino, agricultura, producción de mochilas, producción de quinua.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Esther es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de agricultura (producción de papa); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás ya que el mismo es un negocio familiar, cuando tuvo su pareja deciden ambos trabajar en el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla) que adquirirá de las tiendas de La Paz y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella está combinando.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Los Pinos” communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional center.  It is comprised of nine members and led by a board of directors.  Esther is the treasurer.  The businesses of the communal bank members are varied and include knitting gloves, buying and selling potatoes and ‘chuño’ (dehydrated potatoes), knitting hats, buying and selling cattle and sheep, farming, making backpacks, and quinoa production.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Esther is a member.  She said that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a friend, who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a farming business (potato production).  She says that she learned this business several years ago because it is a family business.  When she got her life partner, they decided to both work in the same business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital to buy seeds that she will buy from the stores in La Paz.  After the harvest, she will sell her product at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family because she is in a partnership.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria  vive en  la ciudad de Villa Elisa , tiene 62 años  está casada con el Sr. Rodolfo, quien también cuenta con un pequeño taller mecánico cerca de su casa
Maria cuenta que se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene una pequeña despensa en donde ofrece todos los productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes, además hace comestibles para vender y llevar ya que le encanta la cocina.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza por poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de como arroz, fideo, azúcar, carnes, lácteos, bebidas en general para poder surtir su despensa.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Villa Elisa. She is 62 years old and is married to Rodolfo, who has a small workshop near their house.

María makes her living in the commercial sector; she has a small grocery store where she offers her customers all types of basic necessities, as well as makes food for takeout, since she loves to cook.

She is very hardworking and entrepreneurial; she strives to be able to improve her and her family’s life.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy products such as rice, noodles, sugar, meat, dairy products, and drinks in general to stock her grocery store. 
.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, meat, dairy products, and drinks in general.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana maria es una mujer muy trabajadora vive en un su casa de su familia en la zona de Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente elaboracion de codos y cajas electricas con maquinas dobladoras y de forma para cajas electricas, su esposo esta actualmente en argentina trabajando en la costura envia y giros para su familia y poder formar un buen patrimonio junto a su esposa. Ella comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 18 la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad, La Sra. Ana Maria necesita el credito para poder adquirir mas material (tubos de diferentes diametros) debido a la demanda de sus productos ya que que ella realiza sus trabajos con mucha calidad, con este motivo poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder apoyar a sus hijo en el desarrollo academico y escolar.

El sueño de la Sra. Ana Maria es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
esta es la cuarta vez que solicita cr´ñedito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Ana María is a hard-working woman. She lives in her family home in Pasankeri, in the city of La Paz. Ana mainly makes a living selling elbows (for plumbing) and electrical boxes and bending machines. Her husband is currently working as a tailor in Argentina. He sends money home for the family and, alongside his wife, they are able to build up a good inheritance for their children.  Ana starts works at 8am and continues until 6pm in the Pasankeri area of the city. Ana needs this loan in order to buy more material (pipes of different sizes) because of the demand for her high-quality products. With this loan, Ana can improve her income and will be able to support her children with their studies.

Ana's dream is have a higher income through the family's sacrifice, and to enjoy her old-age in peace. Ana hopes to have an income in her old-age that will allow her to improve her quality of life.

This is the fourth time that Ana has applied for a loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pipes of different diameters in order to continue with her business making elbows (for plumbing) and electrical boxes.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr Sergio es un hombre muy trabajador; vive en un su casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a trabajar con su bus propio afiliado en uno de los sindicatos de choeferes de la ciudad de La Paz. La esposa es ama de casa.
Sergio comienza sus actividades desde las 6 de la Mañana y termina a las 22 la zona central  de la ciudad.  El Sr. Sergio necesita el credito para poder poner en buenas consiciones sus vehiculo ya que tubo problemas con el motor actualmente y asi tener mejor ingresos y poder brindar un buen servicio a sus pasajeros. Necesita un chequeo general y mantenimientode su movilidad.

El sueño de el Sr. Sergio es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio is a hard-working man who lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone located in the city of La Paz. He dedicates himself principally to conducting his own bus, which is affiliated with one of the driver syndicates in the city of La Paz. His spouse is a house wife.

Sergio begins his activities at 6:00 am and finishes at 10:00 pm, driving in the city's central zone. He needs the loan to be able to restore his bus to good condition, since he has had problems with the motor. This will bring in a higher income and allow him to offer his passengers better service. His bus needs a general check up and maintenance to improve its mobility.

Sergio's dream is to be able to have a higher income for the sacrifice he makes and to enjoy a more tranquil old age. He hopes he can count on a salary in old age that will permit him to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: pay for general repairs on his passenger bus that serves the city of La Paz.

loans.name: Maa Biraja Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Biraja Shg is a self-help group consisting of 13 members from a small village of Odisha, India. All the group members are women and all are engaged in different business activities like milk selling, food stall, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Manju is a member and president of the Maa Biraja Shg self-help group, and she lives in a small village of Odisha, India. In picture, the lady standing with raised hand is Manju. She is 39 years old and married. Her husband works as a daily laborer in a factory situated near the city. Together they have four children between 10 and 16 years old. All their children attend school.

Manju has sold various products (personnel care items, soap, clothes, slippers, etc.) from hers shop for six years. This will be her first loan with the field partner People's Forum. She plans to use her portion of this loan to increase her working capital and buy slippers, personnel care products and clothing. She will then sell these products to increase her earnings.

In the coming years, Manju would like to build a solid and long-lasting house, buy bicycles and provide for her children's schooling.

loans.use: To purchase slippers, personnel care products and clothing for retail.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a high population area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy greater quantities of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Katherime Rosalinda

texts.es:
Katherime es un joven con mucho entusiasmo, vive en la ciudad de Sayan, y trabaja como asistente en centro pre-universitario de su ciudad, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder seguir adelante.

Katherime esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo Katherime podrá comprar unos audífonos especiales para la sordera, para su abuela, de esta manera ella podrá seguir adelante y sobre todo poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su abuela.
texts.en:
Katherime is a young woman with much enthusiasm. She lives in the city of Sayan and works as an assistant in a pre-university center in her city. This allows her to have sufficient income to forge ahead.

Katherime is grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, Katherime will be able to purchase special hearing aids to address her grandmother's deafness. In this manner, Katherime will be able to continue advancing and, above all, offer her grandmother a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hearing aids for her grandmother's deafness.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane, un jeune de 30 ans est agent de développement  de profession. Il s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaires depuis plus de 5 ans. Il exploite un espace dans la maison où il a ouvert une boutique. Ousmane est un habitué du guichet et ce renouvellement lui permettra d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, du savon, du lait… pour mettre dans sa boutique. Pour les charges, il appuie les dépenses de sa mère et de ses frères et sœurs parce qu’il est célibataire sans enfant. 
Ousmane est un jeune très ambitieux qui désire agrandir et diversifier son activité. Il veut faire de l’aviculture et augmenter son espace commerciale. Il a aussi comme projet, de construire un bâtiment et de le mettre en location ce qui augmenterai ses revenus et permettra de mettre à l’aise sa famille
texts.en:
Ousmane, age 30, is a development officer by trade. He has been selling foodstuffs for over 5 years. He conducts his sales out of his home where he uses a particular area as a store. Ousmane is a frequent borrower with this branch, and this loan renewal will allow him to buy rice, oil, soap, milk, etc. to stock his store. Being a single man without children, he helps with the expenses of his mother and siblings. 

Ousmane is very ambitious. He wants to bolster and diversify his activities. He would like to launch a poultry farming business and expand his commercial premises. He also wants to build a rental property to bolster his income and provide for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell in his store.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Vanadzor in Lori region. Gohar operates her own business selling clothes. She rents a shop where she sells women's clothes, underwear, shoes, and boots. Her husband helps her very much by driving to Georgia and bringing back large assortments of woman shoes and winter boots. He also drives to Yerevan and brings clothes from there. 

Gohar is not novice in selling and she knows how to attract customers and have a good sale during a day. Gohar is very polite and patient with her customers and she is always ready to give advice and help them with correct choice of clothes or shoes.  Gohar is requesting her second loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to renew her shop’s clothes and shoes assortment.

loans.use: to renew her shop’s clothes and shoes assortment for the winter season

loans.name: Isis Flora

texts.es:
Isis  tiene 24 años, es unida con el padre de hijo, y  tiene un hijo.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Isis trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz y a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia.  El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

En su tiempo libre comparte con la familia. El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, herbicidas y parala balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos

Su meta es que los cultivos salgan bien para vender en buen precio y tener mejores ganancias.

En los tiempos libres les gustaria viajar a la playa.
texts.en:
Isis, who is 24, is married and has one son.  She lives in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos Province.  

She is a member of the Aso 10 de Septiembre rural communal bank which is located in Lechugalito, an area which belongs to Ventanas canton in Los Ríos Province.
