And so Ruth is applying for a loan from COMIXMUL, in order to cover the costs of the birth.  

Ruth's biggest desire and dream is for her baby to be born healthy and that there are no problems that may affect her son.  After the birth, Ruth's plans and goals are to recover her health quickly so that she can find a new job.  She had to leave her previous job due to the risk to the pregnancy.  Leaving the job allowed Ruth to look after her unborn baby's health.

loans.use: to pay hospital costs to give birth and to pay for surgery.

loans.name: Clara Janeth

texts.es:
Clara Janeth tiene 40 años de edad estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.


Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Clara Janeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, urea, insecticidas, herbicidas. Las compras las realizará en Mocache.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en los insumos y preparar la tierra para las siembras. El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar actividades domesticas y alimentar a las aves.
texts.en:
Clara Janeth, 40, is in a free civil union. She has 2 children and lives with the children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the San Francisco communal bank, which is located in the Pantano precinct, part of the Ventanas canton. They make their living in agricultural and livestock labor.

Clara Janeth works in agriculture, in the planting of corn. Additionally, she works raising chickens and pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, insecticides, herbicides. She will carry out the purchases in Mocache.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to invest in the supplies and prepare the earth for the planting. The dream is to buy land to construct a house. In her free time, she likes to carry out domestic activities and feed the birds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing corn.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru:
Абдукариму 62 года. Он из района Гиссар. У него большая семья, состоящая из его жены, двое дочерей и трое сыновей. Жена и дочери домохозяйки. Они дома занимаются домашними делам и присматривают за скотами. Абдукарим вместе с сыновьями занимается строительными работами. Они строят дома. 
    На данный момент они строят дом для своей большой семьи. Абдукарим долго хотел сам своей семье построить дом. Его мечта почти сбылась, но он не смог закончить строительство. У Абдукарима не хватило средств для постройки крыши. Он решился обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить шифер и скорее построить крышу до зимы. Помогите Абдукариму построить крышу!
texts.en: Abdukarim is 62 years old. He is from the Gissar district and has a large family, consisting of his wife, two daughters, and three sons. His wife and daughters take care of the household and look after the cattle. Abdukarim and his sons work in construction building houses. They are currently building a house for their large family. Abdukarim has wanted to build a house for his family for a long time. His dream nearly came true, but he wasn't able to finish building because he did not have the means to build the roof. He decided to apply for a loan to buy slate and quickly finish building the roof before winter. Help Abdukarim build the roof!

loans.use: to purchase the materials to build a roof

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada con Sinecio y tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Zoila, es la crianza de pollos, ésta crianza lo realiza en su propio terreno, donde tiene instalado un espacio con una capacidad de hasta 100 pollos, lleva en está actividad un promedio de 05 años consecutivos, tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida  por los vecinos y compradores  mayoristas de pollos, ésta actividad lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es rentable, le da un buen ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus gastos, y le permite estar en todo momento con sus hijos. Lo que no le gusta es que los alimentos del pollo varían en el precio, lo cual hacen variar sus márgenes de ganancia, pero  esto no la desanima a seguir trabajando. Nos comenta que tiene planes de criar mayor cantidad de pollos por que así obtendrá mayor ingreso económico. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 1000, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará hojas de plátano que se utilizan para  cambiar y ampliar su espacio para criar pollos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Zoila is 47 years old; she is married to Sinecio and has a 19-year-old son who lives with her in her own home.  Zoila raises chickens for a living.  She does this on her own land, where she has set up a space that can hold up to 100 chickens.  She has been in this business for about 5 years straight, during which time she has made herself known to her neighbors and the wholesale chicken buyers.  She does this work with the help of her son.  What she likes about her business is that it is profitable; it provides her with good income that allows her to cover her expenses; and it allows her to be with her children at all times.  What she does not like is that the price of chicken feed varies, which makes her profit margins vary, but this does not discourage her from continuing to work.  She tells us that she has plans to raise a larger number of chickens so she will make more profit.  She is currently requesting 1.000 soles and she is thankful for the financial support she is receiving to keep going.  She also promises to make her payments on time. 

With the requested loan she will buy banana leaves, which she uses to change and expand her space to raise more chickens.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves to expand her farm.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana agradece los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y pudo comprar mercadería y así pudo incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua venta de comida por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, arroz, fideos, aceite, papa y otras cosas, ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Juliana is grateful to lenders for their support as she could buy goods and increase her business capital in this way. She is still selling food and this is why she is using this opportunity to ask for a loan to buy goods such as vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, potatoes and other items. She is a member of the communal bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated to the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sreyath's Group

texts.en:
SreyAth (pictured in the middle of the group) is a young woman who is the breadwinner for her family, which consists of herself and her two small children. The family lives in Battambang province. To support her family and to alleviate their hardship, she farms rice on two hectares of farmland, and also grows pineapples. She has been engaged in this business for three years and can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first time SreyAth has requested a loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She has teamed up with a group of two other borrowers to receive her first loan. As the leader of the group, she intends to spend her entire loan portion on buying fertilizer for her pineapple plantation and to pay reaping fees. 

Her goal is to receive a good yield and to obtain a good selling price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her pineapple plantation and to pay reaping fees

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en: Pao, age 50, is a resident from the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. She struggles for a living by rice farming on a three hectares area and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The current business, which she has been involved with for more than ten years, has returned her  almost 28,000 KHR per day.  Including this loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loan, that she has successfully repaid, enabled her to better improve her living than before. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for a reaping fee. She highly believes that she can gain a good income from her business.

loans.use: To pay for a reaping fee.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia, a 30-year-old man, lives in a small village of Tianeti district with his parents. His father is provided with a retirement pension of 150 GEL per month. The family runs an agricultural business; they have 2 cows whose milk is used in cheese products. They sell cheese in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. They generate 200 GEL from selling cheese.

Gia wants to start his own business activity and requested a loan. He needs 3,000 USD to buy a mini bus. The start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to start a business. After purchasing the mini bus, he will work on a mini bus line to transport people. He will also serve local schools to transport children between their homes and their schools. Gia is a very motivated person and hopes that the new business will be profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a mini bus to transport people

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain, age 33, owns a shop where he sells cosmetics, soaps, and perfumes. He established his business in 2004 and has gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area, due in part to the strategic location of his shop in the market.

Hussain and his wife have three children. He is the sole provider for his family.

Hussain is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 USD, which he will use to renovate his shop, install a display window, and add signage. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to pay the tuition fees of his children and promise them a bright future.

loans.use: to renovate his shop, install a display window, and add signage

loans.name: Maa Narayani Group

texts.en:
Maa Narayani is a Joint Liability Group of six poor women of a rural village, Chanabeda, of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. This group was formed to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the expansion of existing businesses. 

Jayanti, a simple and confident lady, is one of the members of this group. She hails from a poor family living below the poverty line. The lady standing third from the left in the photo and raising her hand is Jayanti. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband, one son of thirteen years, and two daughters of eleven and four years of age, in a small mud house. Her elder daughter and son are continuing their studies in the village school. 

Jayanti has been running a tiffin stall with selling of eggs for the last five years in her village, with the hand-holding support of her husband. Jayanti prepares breakfast items like samosa, wada, potato chup (local names for different types of snacks), etc. Her stall is very popular due to good-quality items. She starts her tiffin stall at 8:00 a.m. in the morning and closes at 6:00 pm in the evening. 

Due to the rural base, she earns a little monthly income of 4,000 INR from the above business. With this small income, she is hardly able to manage her household and the educational expenses of her children. She had wanted to expand the business, but finance was a constraint for her. 

When she learned about Mahashakti Foundation, she joined in the group and has taken a loan of 10,000 INR for expansion of her business. With the present loan, Jayanti wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. to increase the quantity of items. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she has to replenish her stock frequently from the nearest market of five kilometers away. 

Jayanti hopes to save enough to construct a permanent cabin for her tiffin stall and construct a house for her family. 

The other five members of the group are Banita, Sabhya, Bhagyabati, Indira and Phulmani, who are running a fruits stall, tea and tiffin stall, general store, dry food vending business, and tea stall respectively.

loans.use: to pay for oil, dough, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Tugiribirama Group

texts.fr:
Fulgence fait partie du groupe  Tugiribirama  et habite à  Bubanza. Il  a 48 ans et est marié  à Imelda, une  commerçante.  

Il  fait le commerce de bière  depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 7 caisses de bière Amstel   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  ouvrir une petite boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Fulgence is a member of the Tugiribirama Group and lives in Bubanza. He is 48 years old and married to Imelda, who is a retailer. Fulgence has sold beer for 10 years now.

This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan he plans to increase the capital of his business by buying seven cases of Amstel beer, which he will resell for a profit.

In the coming years, Fulgence would like to open a small store, and he would like to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy seven cases of Amstel beer to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – из Павлограда. Она торгует на местном рынке хозяйственными промышленными товарами. Торговые точки она давно выкупила. Работает в этом направлении уже 7 лет. 
Светлане понадобилась дополнительная финансовая помощь в размере 23 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить несколько групп промтоваров на продажу, а именно искуственные елки, игрушки к праздникам, мишуру, тапки, галоши и другую мелочевку.
texts.en: Svetlana is from Pavlograd. She has a retail shop at the local market. She bought her store a long time ago and has been working there for seven years. Svetlana needed additional financial support in the amount of 23,000 hryvnia to purchase a few different kinds of retail goods to sell, namely, artificial Christmas trees, holiday toys, tinsel, slippers, galoshes, and other little things.

loans.use: to purchase artificial Christmas trees, toys, tinsel and other retail items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel a newly purchased house that is in a very poor condition

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлане 38 лет, она замужем, воспитывает сына подростка. Она - предпринимательница из Мелитополя. Она уже 12 лет торгует на местном рынке женским и мужским бельем, а также трикотажными изделиями. Место для торговли у Светланы собственное. 
Светлане необходима сумма в 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить новую партию женского белья. Богатый опыт работы в торговле помогает Светлане мудро планировать свои финансы и делать выгодные вклады в качественную продукцию, которую она потом успешно реализует.
texts.en:
Svetlana is 38 years old, married, and is raising a teenaged son. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. For 12 years already, she has been trading at the local market women's and men's underwear, and also knitted items. Svetlana has her own place for trade.

Svetlana needs a sum of 30,000 hryvnia to purchase a new parcel of women's underwear. Rich experience working in trade helps Svetlana to wisely plan her finances and to make profitable investments in high-quality products, that she then successfully sells.

loans.use: to purchase women's lingerie for sale

loans.name: Erick Ernesto

texts.es: Erick de 32 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa desde hace dos años. Erick trabaja como electricista desde hace mucho tiempo, dicho oficio le permite ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar por lo que no recibe remuneración por el trabajo que realiza. Erick ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de su pequeña y humilde casa ya que actualmente vive con sus suegros y desea mudarse lo antes posible. Con el crédito comprará lamina galvanizada, madera y polines, espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así proceder a construir su vivienda que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
32-year-old Erick has lived in his own home with his wife for two years. Erick has worked as an electrician for a long time. This job allows him to make a living and support his household. His spouse works as a homemaker, so she doesn't get paid for the work that she does.

Erick decided to request this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the construction of his small and humble home. At the moment he lives with his mother- and father-in-law and he would like to move as soon as possible.

With this loan, he will buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and roofing supports. He hopes to receive this funding and use it to proceed with building the home that he needs so badly.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood and roofing supports to build his home.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 24-year-old married man. He describes himself to be hardworking and ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phones and phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area which is productive with less competition, and his primary customers are the general public.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital to buy more stock. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stock of mobile phones and phone accessories. His business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will give his family the best in terms of education, shelter and food. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully. Godfrey also owns a motorcycle with which he offers transport services. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to add stock of mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman and she has 6 children. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food and tea to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough funds to buy more stock of ingredients.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of ingredients like sugar, wheat and maize flour, milk, salt, cooking oil, etc., for preparing food to sell in the restaurant. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients

loans.name: Enrique Porfirio

texts.es: Enrique agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, él continua con la venta de ceviche por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limones, pescados, sal, cebollas, lechugas y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Enrique is thankful to his investors for the loan and for the support that they have offered. He continues to sell ceviche. For this reason, he currently needs a loan to purchase inputs, such as limes, fish, salt, onions, lettuce and other items. He is grateful to all those who are participating in his dream in this way. He values this loan and is committed to making all of his monthly loan payments in a very responsible way.

loans.use: to purchase limes, fish, salt, onions, lettuce and other ingredients.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual continúa dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Pascual continues to work in agriculture and to raise livestock. On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He is thankful to those who are participating in his dream in this way. He values this loan and is committed to making his monthly loan payments with great responsibility.

Pascual belongs to the communal bank "San Marticito" with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена - из Павлограда. Она разведена, у нее есть взрослая дочь. Она торгует на местном рынке постельными принадлежностями и разными товарами по сезону, на данный момент это новогодние  украшения. Торговая точка у Елены выкуплена, опыт работы в этой сфере у Елены 10 лет. 
Елена планирует закупить товар к сезону под продажу, а именно банные полотенца, одеяла из овчины, пледы, елочные гирлянды, игрушки и маски к праздникам. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 30 000 гривен. Бизнес у Елены налаженный, она хочет продолжать развивать его и расти как частный предприниматель.
texts.en:
Yelena is from Pavlograd. She is divorced and has a grown daughter. She trades at the local market bedding and various goods in season; currently, it's holiday decorations. Yelena has a trade spot which she purchased. Yelena has ten years of experience in this sphere of work.

Yelena plans to buy seasonal goods to sell, namely bath towels, sheepskin blankets, carpets, Christmas garlands, toys and masks for the holidays. For this, she needs a sum of 30,000 hryvnia. Yelena has a streamlined business, and she wants to continue to develop it and to grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase bath towels, blankets, tinsel, toys, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 9 to 21 years. She describes herself to be humble and obedient.

She operates a retail shop where she sells cereals and other items. She describes her family's challenge to be a lack of enough funds to enable them to access enough clean water.

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a 5,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit seven family members. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to access enough clean water. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 5,000 liter water tank

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 52-year-old married man and he has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined.

He operates a retail business where he sells electronics and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough funds to buy more stock. 

He will use the 80,000 KES loan to add stock of electronics for resale. His business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business and educate his children. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 80,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business and expand it further.

loans.use: to add stock of electronics

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children aged 1 year and 2 years. He describes himself to be talkative. He operates a retail business where he sells onions. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough funds to buy more stock. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stocks of onions for resale. His business goal is to have a retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children up to graduate level. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: add stocks of onions for resale.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия – из Виноградово. Она торгует детской одеждой в местном магазине. Наталия торговую точку арендует, наемных рабочих у нее нет. Наталия замужем, у нее двое детей. Любят всей семьей ездить на отдых в Израиль.
Наталия планирует использовать сумму в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт двух комнат: пошпаклевать и покрасить стены в обеих комнатах, наклеить керамическую плитку на пол, а также установить входные двери и окна в одну из комнат.
texts.en:
Nataliya is from Vinogradovo. She sells children's clothing at a local store. Nataliya rents a trading spot and she has no employees. Nataliya is married and has two children. The whole family loves to go on vacation to Israel.

Nataliya plans to use a sum of 20,000 hryvnia to do repairs on two rooms: to spackel and paint the walls in both rooms, to plaster ceramic tiles on the floor, and also to install doors and windows in one of the rooms.

loans.use: to remodel two rooms in her house

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор уже пользовался финансовой помощью КИВА. За счет расширения производства и неизменно высокого качества изготовляемой продукции у Виктора появились постоянные клиенты. В частности одна частная гостиница стала постоянно делать у него заказы. Виктор же, в свою очередь, смог теперь начать делать мебель сложнее, еще лучшего качества. За счет постоянного дохода Виктор смог купить дом и сделать там ремонт. Сложнее всего Виктору с персоналом, трудно обучать подчиненных, чтобы приучить и их достигать требуемого качества. 
В этот раз Виктор обратился за суммой в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести малогабаритный станок для корпусной мебели и шкафов-купе. Приобретение данного станка значительно поможет бизнесу Виктора не только начать изготавливать еще более сложные мебельные конструкции, но также ускорить выполнение заказов.
texts.en:
Viktor has already used the financial help of Kiva. Due to the increase in production and the consistently high quality of production of his goods, Viktor has loyal customers. In particular, one private hotel became a regular customer, making him regular orders. Viktor in turn could then begin to make more complicated furniture, and of a better quality. Due to the regular income, Viktor was able to buy a home and make repairs there. The biggest difficult for Viktor is with personnel; it is difficult to train subordinates, to teach them and to achieve the required quality.

This time, Viktor applied for a sum of 8,000 hryvnia to acquire a compact machine for cabinet furniture and wardrobes. The purchase of this machine will help Viktor's business not only to start producing even more complication furniture constructions, but also to speed up order fulfilment.

loans.use: to purchase a special small-sized machine tool

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 48 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación de las paredes de la vivienda, con el crédito comprara ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Confía que con lo que gana con la prestación de servicios domésticos logrará cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Teresa, 48 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two children. She has made her living offering domestic services for a long time, and supports her home this way.

She would like to improve her family's living conditions, which is why she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in repairing the walls of her house. With the loan, she will buy bricks, cement, sand and iron.

She is confident that with what she earns doing domestic work, she will be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Sasha

texts.en: Sasha is a 22-year-old young man. He lives in the suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi, with his parents, brother, and cousin. His father works as a security guard and gets GEL 200 per month. Sasha serves local people as a taxi driver. He needs to install gas equipment in his car to decrease expenses and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of USD 1,700 to install gas equipment in his taxi. As the gas equipment is installed in his taxi, the transportation cost will decrease and the income will increase. With this increased income Sasha will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Ruben Gil

texts.es:
Ruben tiene 19 años y vive en la ciudad de Camaná, trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder apoyar con algunos gastos del hogar de sus padres. Ruben trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo quiere salir adelante.

Ruben está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá solventar algunos gastos como compra de enseres y refacción del techo de su hogar, ya que se encuentra un poco agrietado, de esta manera podrá salir adelante y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener una carrera  universitaria”.
texts.en:
Ruben is 19 and lives in the city of Camaná. He works as a labourer on a farm in his city, which allows him to have an income to help out with some of the costs of running his parents' house. Ruben works about 9 hours a day and believes he does well in his work as he is very responsible and, above all, he wants to get ahead in life.

Ruben is grateful to Kiva Lenders because, thanks to their great support, he will be able to cover some expenses such as paying for materials and repairs to the house's roof as this is rather cracked. In this way he can get ahead and continue to fight to make his great dream a reality: to own his own house and to have a university career.

loans.use: to pay for materials and repair of the roof on his house.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg is from Vanadzor town, where he is providing shipping services to the local stores. Gevorg, with his own car, delivers different types of sweets and candies to local stores. Gevorg lives with his parents and sister, who is 16 years old. The income that he gets from this activity is very important for the whole family's living. Now, because of financial difficulties that Gevorg faces, he is unable to purchase needed supplies for delivering to the stores and selling them. That's the reason Gevorg asks for this loan of USD 3,000 from Kiva lenders. He plans to purchase supplies (candies, sweets) and resell them to the local stores. As this is Gervog's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. This loan will be a huge support to this hardworking man and he will be very grateful for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies (candies, sweets) for reselling to the local stores

loans.name: Amos' Group

texts.en:
Amos is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 87 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Amos has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
							
Amos is married and has three children. He is 25 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Amos has been a farmer for eight years. Amos described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Amos first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Amos joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer, and hybrid seeds. He also wants to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, is an active community member, wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.

Amos and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

Please note that there is one additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.						

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad de clima cálido y amable. Junior para poder salir adelante trabaja como mozo en un restaurante de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y los fines de semana puede trabajar un poco mas ya que llegan  muchos turistas; Junior cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es amable y sobre todo respetuoso.

Junior está agradecido con los prestamista kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una mototaxi, para poder alquilarla y de esta manera tener un ingreso mas para poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo de 2 años.
texts.en:
Junior lives in the city of Chiclayo, a city with a warm and pleasant climate. In order to get ahead, Junior works as a waiter in a restaurant in his city. He works around 10 hours a day, and on weekends he can work a little more, since they get many tourists. Junior believes that his work is going well because he is friendly and, above all, respectful.

Junior is grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a moto-taxi to rent out and have another income. This will allow him to get ahead, and above all, to give a better quality of life to his 2-year old son.

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 30 years old, female, and married. She has six children aged 18, 17, 13, 11, 8, and 6 years respectively, whom she supports. She runs a grocery business that has lasted for six years now. She earns a monthly income of KES 4,050. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she is taking a first loan from Kadet of KES 10,000, which she intends to use to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, danias, and onions She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open another grocery shop and also make sure her children are educated.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, danias, and onions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah. a 34-year-old widowed mother of three, has been selling cereals in the town of Oloitoktok  for seven years now. Right now her monthly income is KES. 7,500.

Now requesting her second loan after having repaid the previous one, Priscillah will buy more cereals for resale, including beans, maize and rice. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. In future, Priscillah hopes to build her own home as well as provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of cereals for reale

loans.name: José Napoleón

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad,  actualmente trabaja en la agricultura, él no tiene ningún grado de estudio por sus escasos recursos económicos, vive con su compañera de vida que se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y sus hijoslos cuales 2 esta estudiando.


 Actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz y maicillo y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo pues en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, además de trabajar en la agricultura, él se dedica a comprar y vender cerdos y ganado, se levanta desde las 4:00 AM y tiene que trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de unos 6 kilómetros en bicicleta, hora de salida no tiene pues hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado en ese día regresa a su casa y le ayuda su hijo mayor en el tiempo en el cual no está estudiando.   


 utilizará el dinero del préstamo, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ya que en este mes empiezan a preparar la tierra para cultivar, ademas tiene pensado comprar una novilla que dentro de muy poco ya sera vaca, un cerdo pequeño que entre 5 meses estará vendiendo con alguna ganancia.

En el futuro, él tiene la visión de tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que él no tuvo, él está seguro que el crédito es un compromiso, pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños, será un mayor esfuerzo pero así obtendrá una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
José, 35, currently works in agriculture. He does not have any schooling because of scant economic resources. He lives with his life partner who works doing the chores of the house and the two kids, both of which are studying.

Currently, he makes his living planting corn and sorghum and has done this since he was a boy, since his father taught him this work. In those days, they didn't have any other way to survive except agriculture. In addition to working in agriculture, he works buying and selling pigs and cattle. He gets up at 4:00 AM and has to go to the country where he has a cornfield. He makes a journey of some 6 kilometers by bicycle; he does not have a leaving time until he finishes doing what he has planned for that day. He returns to his house and his eldest son helps in the time when he is not studying.

He will use the money from the loan to sow 7,000 square meters of corn, since this month they begin to prepare the land for cultivation. Additionally, he has thought of buying a heifer that in little time will be a cow, a small pig that in 5 months he will be selling with some profit.

In the future, he has the vision of having a better house than the one he has now, being able to give his children the schooling he didn't have. He is sure that the loan is a commitment, but he also knows that only in this way can he achieve his dreams. It will be a stronger effort but in this way he will obtain a better economic situation.

loans.use: to sow 7,000 sq. m of corn, to buy a heifer and a small pig to sell.

loans.name: Deyra Aracelys

texts.es: Deyra es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de dos hijos uno de ellos ya independiente. Tiene 34 años de edad. De oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace  muchos años con la venta de pan y frutas luego sus familiares le dieron la idea de que comenzara a vender otros productos de consumo del hogar y fue así como comenzó la pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Azúcar, Frijoles, productos escolares entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias. Su plan futuro es sacar adelante a sus hijos e incrementar el tamaño de su negocio.
texts.en:
Deyra comes from the city of Estelí. She is 34, married, and the mother of two children, one of whom is now independent. She is a shopkeeper and has a neighbourhood grocery store. She started her business years ago by selling bread and fruit. Then her family gave her the idea of starting to sell other products for household consumption and so it was that she set up the grocery store.

Deyra is asking for the loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, beans and school products. She believes the loan will be a great help in improving her sales and in making a better profit. Her plan for the future is to give her children a good education and to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, beans and school products.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Meet Janet--a farmer residing in the highland of Kericho with her four children. She has practiced farming for four years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables. She invests a lot in poultry farming because she easily gets an available market and production is on the increase. Her biggest challenge is an outbreak of diseases affecting poultry.

Janet chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have low interest rates on their loans. This loan will enable her to purchase more poultry, which will increase egg production and thus increase income. This will help her give better education to her children and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to do poultry keeping.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of nine farmers in Matete District, with Peter selected as the Kiva representative. Peter has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised.  

Farming inputs will be delivered to Peter and the 89 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).	
						
Peter is 64 years old and has been a farmer for 34 years. Peter works as a farmer to provide for his 13 children. The community and other farmers know Peter as friendly, hard-working, and trustworthy. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community, such as the prayer group and burial committee. Peter described his harvest last year as being good, but he hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
Peter joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season, as a group leader. Peter joined One Acre Fund, so that he could get new farming methods, fertilizer, and hybrid seeds. Because he likes being a leader, Peter has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund, as a group leader and as a Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Peter's life because he was able to save money and he was able to feed the family. In the future, Peter hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and to invest in a business.

Peter and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. 

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

Please note that there are two additional group leaders in this photo that will be working with One Acre Fund, but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi, age 47, is from the village of Dzirula. He is living with his wife and retired mother. The family earns their main income from an agricultural business. Specifically, Goderdzi has one milking cow, three calves, eight sheep, and eight beehives with bee colonies. His wife makes cheese for selling as well as for family consumption. 

In order to generate a stable monthly income, Goderdzi decided to start up a grocery store in his village and sell various food products. The family has already built a store and now is requesting a loan to buy stocks of merchandise, such as meat and dairy products, oil, pasta, rice, and other products. Goderdzi and his wife will work as salespersons and serve their clients in a friendly way. The family will get monthly income and they will be able to cover household expenses as well as improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start a grocery store

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina continua vendiendo chicha de jora por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, jora, harina, cerveza y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Gabina continues to sell the beverage chicha and, in order to do so, she needs a loan to purchase supplies like sugar, special corn used to prepare chicha, flour, beer and other items. She is thankful to those who have formed a part of her dream. She values the loan and promises to fulfill her responsibilities to make her monthly repayments on time. 

She belongs to the communal bank "San Martincito," a part of the Association Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy supplies: sugar, corn used to make chicha, flour, beer, and others.

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en: Phidelis is a 30-year-old married female. She has two (2) children who are five and three-years-old, whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she sells milk. She has been in this business for two years.  In her business she earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her third loan of 30,000 KES which she intends to use to buy more milk.  Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was paid back successfully. Phidelis will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has a barber shop in Kangundo town and he has been running this business for the last year. He is 24 years old and married, with no children. He supports his younger brother. Besides the barber shop, Francis also has a mobile money transfer business. 

Francis will use this loan to buy shaving machines and other items for use in his business, such as hair oil, towels, shampoo, and hair brushes. He will also use part of the loan as money float for his mobile money transfer business. 

Francis will use the anticipated profits to save for his family's future needs. This is his first loan term and he hopes to give his family a good life as well as to pay school fees for his brother.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines and other supplies for his barber shop business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, a 48-year-old married father of four, has a welding business in Kangundo where he makes and repairs metal door frames, window frames, wheelbarrows and metal boxes among other items. He has been in this business for three years, and it has been profitable.

Philip plans to use this loan to buy more welding materials such as metal bars, metal sheets and protective shades for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's needs. 

Philip hopes to grow his business and serve more customers, earn more income and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more welding materials

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 11 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Daniel, on the right of the photo with his hand raised, selected as the Kiva representative. Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 100 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Daniel is 59 years old and has been working as a farmer for 10 years to provide for his four children. The community and other farmers know Daniel as friendly and trustworthy. He is also involved in his community with the men's group, prayer group and burial committee.  Daniel described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

Daniel joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  He joined in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He also wants to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  

Because he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Daniel has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Daniel's life because he has been able to save money and feed his family.  In the future, Daniel hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and buy a cow.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Daniel and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.		

Please note that there are two additional group leaders shown in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.					

The field officer is also included in the photo and is shown standing on the left.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha is 45 years old, married, and has two adult children. He lives in Khotanan village in Syunik region. His wife does not work and he is the only employed person in the family. 

Recently Seryozha repaired his flat but was unable to do the furnishings because of the lack of money. He is requesting a loan for 250,000 Armenian drams, which he will use to buy furniture for his flat.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his flat in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio se dedica al servicios inmobiliarios(arreglos y reparaciones) realizados por cuenta propia, con sus propios utensilios de albañil.

El vive en casa propia ubicado en la Z/Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de  La Paz, aproximadamente a una hora del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Lucio solitia el crédito comprar material de construccion para levantar muro para su vivivenda asi mejorar calidad y seguridad de vida para su familia.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucio provides building services (improvements and repairs) on his own and with his mason tools.

He lives in a home of his own, located in the Z/Bautista Saavedra area of the city of La Paz, about an hour from downtown La Paz.

Lucio is asking for a loan to buy building materials to build a wall for his house and improve his family’s security and quality of life.

This will be his first loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan se dedica al servicio de Internet y juegos en red, trascripciones e impresiones a color y blanco y negro.
El vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto en la z/Villa Ingenio, Departamento de La Paz a cuarenta minutos de distancia  del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Juan es comprar Impresora Grande  que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, asi poder brindar servicio rapido y de calidad al cliente. Para esto, Juan solicita un crédito.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan provides Internet and network gaming services, transcriptions, and color and black and white printing.

He lives at his parents’ house, located in the z/Villa Ingenio area of El Alto, within the La Paz department, 45 minutes from downtown La Paz.

Juan’s dream is to buy a large printer the he needs to improve his work and be able to provide fast, quality service.  Juan is asking for a loan to do this.

This will be his first loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Kitheka

texts.en: Kitheka is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be talkative. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, bread, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of bread, washing soap, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be a rich man. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will the use anticipated profits to invest in the business.

loans.use: add stock of bread, washing soap, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Poderosas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSAS DE JUAN PABLO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, costura de chamarras, servicios de construcción, venta de chuño, tejido de chompas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Andrea es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de manta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigos hace varios años, cuando vio la necesidad de generar recursos económicos decide aplicar esta estrategia de tejido como fuente de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y ahorros.
texts.en:
The “PODEROSAS DE JUAN PABLO” ("The Powerful Women from Juan Pablo") communal bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office. It has eight members and is led by a board, whose president is Andrea. The businesses run by the members of this communal bank are diverse: knitting blankets, sewing jackets, construction services, selling chuño (freeze-dried potato), knitting sweaters, and selling food. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small micro-entrepeneurs, and Andrea is one of them. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three cycles, having entered the group after being invited by a friend, who is a member of this institution. Currently, she has a business knitting blankets, and says that she learned this business from friends many years ago. When she needed to generate income she decided to apply this knitting strategy as a business source..
 
The loan she will take out is to increase capital to purchase wool that she will buy wholesale in the city of La Paz, which she will later use to produce and sell in her sale space. This type of work will allow her to produce resources to support her family, since she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the loan and savings areas.

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a married woman. She has two children, ages three and seven years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and a go-getter. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big grocery shop. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is a 45 year-old married woman. She has three children whose ages range from 14 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be talkative. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps animals. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water for domestic use. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have clean water in her homestead. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Perfecta Teresa

texts.es:
Perfecta tiene 55 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.
Perfecta se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar, insecticidas, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en los trabajos del campo. El sueño es mejorar en el negocio.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y trabajar.
texts.en:
Perfecta is 55 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her children and her husband in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She is a member of the VRC San Francisco group, located in the Pantano District of Ventanas, which works in agriculture and livestock. 

Perfecta grows corn and is seeking this loan to buy insecticides and herbicides. With this loan, she'll be able to invest in her fields, as her dream is to improve her business. The challenges she faces are disease and a poor climate. In her free time she likes to watch TV and work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her corn crops.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has five children whose ages range from seven years to 27 years. He describes himself to be experienced. He operates a farm where he keeps poultry for egg production and also meat. He has been involved in this business for 17 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are mostly restaurant owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock of chicken and their feed. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add stock of poultry and to buy poultry feeds. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: add stock of poultry and buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: El señor José, labora como mensajero de correo, quien actualmente tiene bajo su cargo a 3 hijos, todos estudiantes de la escuela primaria y secundaria, siendo su mayor sueño que ellos sean unos profesionales independientes y puedan valerse por ellos mismos, su esposa Marlene es ama de casa, ella cuida por el orden del hogar, por lo que todos dependen únicamente de don José. El solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para continuar la construcción de un cuarto que viene haciendo por etapas debido a la baja economía, siendo esta la última para concluir la obra, su objetivo es asignarle a sus hijos su propio espacio, así poco a poco irá mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Jose works as a messenger and has three children who attend elementary and middle school.  His greatest dream is for them to become independent professionals.  His wife, Marlene is a housewife and cares for the home.  They all depend on Jose for support and he is asking for a loan to continue building a room that he is doing in stages due to the slow economy.  This will be the last one so he can finish the task.  He wants to provide his children with their own space and little by little be able to improve the living conditions in his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 25 year-old single man. He describes himself to be time-conscious. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock . He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of bananas, watermelons, apples, etc.  His business goal is to expand within fiveyears. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of bananas, watermelons, apples, etc.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.es: Nicasio continua con la venta de ollas, frazadas, colchones y artefactos por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ollas, frazadas y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Nicasio still sells pots, blankets, mattresses, and appliances.  He now seeks a loan to buy more pots, blankets, and other items to sell.  He is thankful to the people that have contributed to his dream by supporting him via a loan, and he promises to comply with the repayment schedule.  

He belongs to the community bank "San Marticito" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy pots, blankets and other items to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a esposo. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 2 años.
Doña María su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y ahí le visitan sus vecinos y amigos a diario, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de aceite, refresco, pan, café, jabón, azúcar, churros, etc. producto que necesita para la tener surtido su negocio,  espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que gracias el contara con los insumos suficientes para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes y así satisfacer las necesidades de los mismos.
Doña María además espera un aumento en las ventas ya que esta época navideña se vende mucho y con esto ganar más ingresos que le permitan mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña María espera seguir apoyando a su familia para cumplir las metas y sueños y que tangan un mejor futuro.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working and responsible person.  She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband.  She has owned and operated a small grocery store for the past 2 years.

Maria's business is located in her home and her neighbors and friends come to buy things from her daily.  This loan is so that she can buy oil, beverages, bread, coffee, soap, sugar, churros, and other products that she needs so that she can support her business.  She hopes that this loan will help her stock her business with the items that will satisfy the demand of her customers and also satisfy their needs.

Maria hopes to increase her sales, especially during this holiday season when she sells a lot. She will be able to earn a higher income which will enable her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Maria hopes to continue supporting her family and reach her dreams and goals so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy oil, beverages, bread, coffee, soap, sugar, churros, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha de 22 años de edad, tiene sexto grado de educación. No tiene esposo pero  tiene una hija la cual cuida y sustenta con su trabajo, la hija tiene 3 años de edad, aun no estudia y vive con ella. 
           
Matha tiene como negocio, una sastrería que instalo en su casa. Tiene 2 años de tener el puesto ya que hace poco termino el aprendizaje de corte y confección que recibió durante dos años y esto le ha permitido dedicarse a esta actividad. Además, las circunstancias de la vida no le han permitido encontrar un trabajo mejor remunerado y es la forma de sobrevivir junto a su hija, en el negocio se involucran dos personas las cuales están aprendiendo de corte y confección, ella les enseña. El horario de trabajo, es según la demanda que tenga, pero  lo normal es de 6 horas al día.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar tela para elaborar diseños de ropa que le están demandando en la comunidad,  es muy conocida, ya que es la única persona que ha aprendido hacer ese oficio y eso le permite que la gente la busque.

El préstamo le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos, ya que cumplirá con la  demanda que tiene  esto también se traducirá en el bienestar de su hija, porque podrá cumplir con las necesidades básicas que tiene ella. 

El sueño de Martha, para su negocio es abrir su propio puesto de sastrería en la ciudad,  pues dice que le gustaría convertirse en una empresaria y que espera su negocio crezca hasta tener  su propia escuela de sastrería para enseñar  a quien desee aprender este oficio. Para su familia, desea que su  hija logre estudiar lo que yo no pude por falta de recursos económicos y por eso ella trabajara duro para darle estudio.

El préstamo le ayudara a tener la materia prima para vender sus prendas.
texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old and she has completed the sixth grade.  She does not have a husband, but she has a daughter whom she takes care of and supports through her work.  Her daughter, who is 3 years old, lives with her and does not yet attend school. 

Martha has a tailor shop that she set up in her house.  She has been doing this work for two years, recently completing two years of training as a dressmaker, which has enabled her to dedicate herself to this occupation.  Also, her circumstances have not allowed her to find a better-paying job, and this is how she and her daughter survive.   As part of her business she works with two people, whom she is teaching dressmaking.  The work schedule varies according to demand, but the work day is normally about 6 hours. 

The loan that she is seeking is for the purchase of fabric to make clothing designs that are in demand in the community. She is well-known, since she is the only person who has learned how to do this work, and people seek her out.

This loan will help her to earn more income, since she will be able to fulfill her demand; and this will translate into well-being for her daughter, as she will be able to provide for her basic needs.

Martha’s dream for her business is to open her own shop in the city, and she says that she would like to become a businesswoman. She hopes that her business will grow until she has her own dressmaking school where she will teach anyone who wants to learn this profession.

Her desire for her family is that her daughter will be able to study what she, for lack of economic resources, could not; and she works hard so that will be able to give her daughter an education.

The loan will help her to have the materials that she needs in order to sell her garments.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in order to make the clothing styles that people in her community are requesting.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a father of seven from Embu, has a business as a horticultural farmer. He is married to Nancy, who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family. This marks his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

With the loan he has applied from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase farm inputs eg fertilizer and seedlings. The additional income created will allow him improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, Joseph would like to take care of his children and pay their school fees with ease. 

He hopes to become a renowned horticultural farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm input, eg fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a 53-year-old married mother of one from Thika, has a business of mixed crop farming. She is married to Patrick, who is also a farmer. Gladys earns a monthly income of KES 12,000 which she uses to support her family. 

This will mark her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya after she was introduced by an existing client. She will use the loan to purchase poultry feeds and day-old chicks for rearing. Additional income created will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Gladys would like to expand her farming land. 

Gladys hopes to save money to further educate her son, who is still in secondary school.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and day-old chicks for rearing

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk lives in Tsovagyugh village in Gegharkunik region. This young farmer, who is at the same time a student (paid division of Yerevan State Economic University, distance learning), is seeking his second loan from Kiva. 

He takes care of his farm so carefully and skillfully that he now thinks that he is able to keep and feed more cattle than he has. At the moment his farm has cows, pigs and chickens. He sells a lot of milk, various dairy products and eggs. Unlike other young people he is extremely interested in farming and has great plans connected to it. 

Manuk lives with his parents and his brother. He used his first loan to buy 3 cows and is now requesting a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several calves which will make his farm richer and also give him a chance to start selling meat.

loans.use: to buy several calves which will make his farm richer and also give him a chance to start selling meat

loans.name: Dirianis

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Dirianis quien con su credikiva pudo comprar materiales e insumos, como carnes frías, harinas, leche, huevos y productos de panadería;  a ella en sus dos negocios, el de confecciones y el de ventas de postresy comidas rápidas, le ha ido muy bien;  así fue que con  su credikiva anterior, pudo atender  oportunamente a su clientela y mantuvo una buena base de clientes. En la actualidad Diranis está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual planea comprar una máquina de confecciones para aumentar su producción de prenda de vestir y materiales e insumos, para invertir en su negocio de comidas rápidas. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “Gracias por la oportunidad que le dan a los empresarios para salir adelante“.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Dirianis with her Kiva loan.  It allowed her to buy materials and supplies  such as cold cuts, flour, milk, eggs, and bakery products.  Things have gone well for her in both of her businesses, making desserts and fast food.  This is how she used her previous Kiva loan.  She was able to serve her customers and keep a good base.

Diranis is asking for a new Kiva loan to buy a machine so she can increase her production of clothing and ingredients for her fast food business.  She sends the following message, “Thank you for the opportunity you give so that entrepreneurs can get ahead.”

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives in Gavar city in the Gegharkunik region. He is married, and he has two daughters and a son. His daughters are married and they live separately with their families. His son is still school-aged. Artak’s wife does not work. Since their son is still small, Artak is the only bread winner in his family.

He used to work at the bread factory as a driver, then for several years he went to the Russian Federation and did construction work. Now he is engaged in farming and agricultural activities.  On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, which he sells through the re-sellers, and he also gathers hay, which he uses as animal fodder for his farm cattle. He has calves and cows, and also a lot of chickens on his farm.

Artak asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, which will be enough during the whole winter.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle for the whole winter

loans.name: Om-Marvt Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Marvt, which consists of three women who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a collective loan of YER 150,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Adila is a 40-year-old, married woman who lives with her family in Aden. She has been in the cloth trade business for many years. She is famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients. She is making enough money to lead a decent life, but she said her income is not sufficient to bear all of the daily expenditures of her family members alone. 

Adila is greatly contributing to the family income to support her family through all of her hard work. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense, and perfumes in larger quantities, to add to her stocks.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense, and perfumes in larger quantities, to add to her stocks.

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr is from Lernavan village of Lori region; he currently lives with his parents.

A few years ago Hrayr came back from Russia, where he was a migrant worker living with his son and wife. He brought with him a truck and decided to run a farming business. His farm currently includes chickens, pigs and cows and also cultivates wheat, barley and different fruits. Hrayr takes the gathered harvest to the open market and sells it. Agriculture is currently his only source of income so Hrayr works hard to gather enough income for his family.

Now, Hrayr is applying for a USD 2000 loan to purchase forage for feeding his livestock and seeds for cultivation. He will be very thankful to Kiva lenders for the loan. 

As this is Hrayr's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit products due to a lack of credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Soqatra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Soqatra, and is made up of five ladies. They live in Aden, Yemen. 

This group is requesting financial assistance from Kiva partner AMB in order to raise their level of activity.  Fatima is the group's representative. She is a 32-year-old married woman, and has four children. She sells different items such as clothes, incense, etc. She started her business with goods she took on credit from merchants. 

She tries hard to improve her living conditions. To meet her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Fatima is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy additional clothes, incense, etc. for her business. She hopes to expand her business in order to improve it.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes, incense, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий 22 года занимается тепличным хозяйством в своей родной Гладковке. Он выращивает в теплицах ранние и поздние помидоры, перец, редис, картофель. У Дмитрия есть свой участок в 33 сотки. 
30 000 гривен понадобились Дмитрию для того, чтобы подготовить теплицы к сезону, закупить полиэтиленовую пленку, удобрения, семена,  а также провести в них отопление и сделать небольшой ремонт там, где это необходимо. Дмитрию нравится вести свое хозяйство, он планирует заниматься им и в будущем, по возможности расширяя его и тем самым обеспечивая нужды своей семьи.
texts.en:
Dmitriy has grown greenhouse vegetables in his hometown of Gladkovka for 22 years. He grows late and early tomatoes, peppers, radishes and potatoes and has his own 3300 square meter plot.  

Dmitriy needs 30,000 hryvnia in order to prepare for the season's planting. He has to buy plastic sheeting, fertilizers, seeds, and also heat the greenhouses and make minor repairs where necessary. Dmitriy likes planting his crops and plans to continue in the future, expanding the business where possible and providing for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy plastic sheeting, fertilizers, and seeds, and to begin heating his greenhouses in order to prepare them for the growing season

loans.name: Norma Evelin

texts.es:
